font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">And Gandhi had\nrecruited &nbsp;millions of Indian soldiers\nfor both world wars , with 111000 Indian soldiers being killed in WW1 and\n243000 soldiers being killed in WW2, without memorials or honor like mules and\nhorses. &nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">These poor soldiers were cannon\nfodder , always in the most dangerous areas. And there was NO sign of British\nleaving India for good, despite the promise they will leave , in case Indians\nsoldiers fight against Germans, notwithstanding Gandhi\u2019s non-violence and\nAhimsa principles.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A Indian scrawled <b><span style=\"color: red;\">BRITISH DOGS QUIT INDIA</span></b>&nbsp; on the sea-shore training establishment&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 115%;\">for training wireless operators&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">( HMIS TALWAR ) wall , and this evoked exemplary punishments\n&nbsp;like cutting off rations , &nbsp;forcing the cook &nbsp;to dilute the curry with water, so that all can\nbe fed. &nbsp;BC&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Dutt was imprisoned on\nsuspicion after comparing his handwriting. And this was a bit too much to\nswallow.</span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">If this was the petty method the British\nOfficers would adopt to make other sailors to snitch on a fellow sailor &nbsp;then\nit would NOT work. &nbsp;&nbsp;Rather this mean tactic would explode badly on\ntheir sarcastic white racist faces.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Brits caught on and\ndid propaganda that the trigger was watery dhall\u2014 like how the trigger in 1857\nfor the stupid Indians were beef and pork lard grease. You see Indians are so\nsmall minded , that they can go on revolt even for watered down curry. &nbsp;Bad Indians, right?<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">It must be on record\nthat the Indian National Congress and Muslim league condemned the uprising. I\nguess Gandhi and Jinnah could NOT tolerate any movement in which they are NOT\nat the steering wheel. It must also be on record that the Communist party of\nIndia supported this movement, without reservation.</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Union Jack was\nlowered from all Royal Navy ships and in its place was hoisted three flags tied\ntogether \u2014 those of the Congress, Muslim League, and the Red Flag of the\nCommunist Party of India (CPI), signifying the unity and downplaying of\ncommunal issues among the mutineers.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This was the first time the British policy\nof \u201cdivide and rule\u201d did NOT work. &nbsp;The\nrebels had unanimously elected &nbsp;a Muslim,\nLeading Signalman M.S Khan and a Sikh, Petty Officer Telegraphist &nbsp;Madan Singh as President and Vice-President\nrespectively.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Gandhi furious at being sidelined , cried ,\n\"A combination between Hindus and Muslims for the purpose of violent\nactions is unholy and will lead to and would probably be a precursor to mutual\nviolence - bad for India and the world.\"<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Gandhi then went one\nstep ahead and commanded the mutineers stop this \u201c bad and unbecoming example\u201d\nand suggested that they must \u201cadopt peaceful methods and apprise him fully of\ntheir grievances he would see to it that they were redressed \u201c.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-fnv8IAv5PFc/UR3ePjd0EgI/AAAAAAAAfIQ/D9_CTosWwqs/s1600/hjo;.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"254\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-fnv8IAv5PFc/UR3ePjd0EgI/AAAAAAAAfIQ/D9_CTosWwqs/s320/hjo;.jpg\" width=\"320\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Gandhi further advised\nthe mutineers to peacefully resign from their jobs if they had any grievances. </span>&nbsp;<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The\nNavy ratings, according to Gandhi, should learn \u201cconstructive activities, such\nas using the spinning wheel and thereby keep the love of freedom burning in\ntheir mind\u201d&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: red; font-size: x-large;\"><b>TEE HEEEE!!</b></span><span style=\"font-size: small;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; line-height: 150%; text-align: center;\">\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://2.bp.blogspot.com/-31U5K70HoTI/UR8D48nB3SI/AAAAAAAAfME/RqcOmOIMVtA/s1600/mahatma_gandhi_abha_manu_20070101.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"266\" src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-31U5K70HoTI/UR8D48nB3SI/AAAAAAAAfME/RqcOmOIMVtA/s400/mahatma_gandhi_abha_manu_20070101.jpg\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"color: red; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><b><br /></b></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 115%;\"><i><span style=\"color: red;\"><b>Gandhi used to sleep naked with Manu\n, Sushila and Abha ( two were young virgins ) &nbsp;and won \u2013nay- &nbsp;lost this \"spiritual battle of the bulge\" after several attempts.. &nbsp;He himself has confessed to this, in his book \"My experiments with truth\".</b></span></i><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 115%;\"><i><span style=\"color: red;\"><b><br /></b></span></i></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: red; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: large; line-height: 150%;\"><b>India navy ratings went\naround Bombay on 19<sup>th</sup> and 20<sup>th</sup> Feb 1946, in lorries,\nholding aloft tricolor flags and the picture of Subhash Chandra Bose . &nbsp;</b></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">There were NO pictures of Gandhi &nbsp;&nbsp;and\nthis upset him to no small extent.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Aruna Asif Ali\ndisagreed with Gandhi and said in a rejoinder that it would be \u201cfar easier to\nunite Hindus and Muslims at the barricade than on the constitutional front\u201d.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; line-height: 150%; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://4.bp.blogspot.com/-c5u8gQsNCIo/UR3A79z3SbI/AAAAAAAAfGw/YbcXKVBC5Ds/s1600/imagesbbnm.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"175\" src=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-c5u8gQsNCIo/UR3A79z3SbI/AAAAAAAAfGw/YbcXKVBC5Ds/s200/imagesbbnm.jpg\" width=\"200\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Gandhi had been\napplying his non-violent satyagraha for 32 years, &nbsp;after he was deposited on the drivers seat of\nthe Indian freedom struggle , imported from South Africa , by Rothschild.&nbsp;\n&nbsp;The British just loved him, for\nhe was their type of freedom fighter, playing Moses. &nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Remember Moses? He just wanted leadership \u2014 &nbsp;and he took the Jews across the Red sea on a\nwild goose chase through the deserts for 40 years, round and round in circles, in\nsearch of the holy land , which was there itself, &nbsp;just beyond the horizon..<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Royal <b><span style=\"color: red;\">Indian Navy</span></b> revolt started\non 18th February 1946, when 1100 naval ratings of ship HMIS Talwar struck work at\nBombay at dawn. &nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/--UjHlSn9Sxc/W8GfVqgfFCI/AAAAAAABeqo/ZikzhiRk9Xk5dpgbZXD4MB5eb5smZKyqwCLcBGAs/s1600/article-HHHHypitiolpwf-1455030250.jpeg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"350\" data-original-width=\"780\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/--UjHlSn9Sxc/W8GfVqgfFCI/AAAAAAABeqo/ZikzhiRk9Xk5dpgbZXD4MB5eb5smZKyqwCLcBGAs/s1600/article-HHHHypitiolpwf-1455030250.jpeg\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">After the outbreak of\nthe mutiny, the first planned move was to take possession of Butcher Island ( where\nthe entire ammunition meant for Bombay Presidency was stocked ) and telephone\nand wireless equipment, including transmitters at Kirki near Pune. </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">This enured that all naval ships were fully\nunder their command.</span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Indian naval\nofficers and ratings &nbsp;began calling\nthemselves the \"Indian National Navy\" , offered left-handed salutes\nto British officers and generally ignored them.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The news of the mutiny was\ncommunicated by signalers and soon at Karachi &nbsp;the HMIS Hindustan along with one more ship\nand three shore establishments, went on a lightning strike. &nbsp;The strikes spread like wild fire to military\nestablishments in Madras, Vishakhapatnam, Calcutta, Delhi, Cochin, Jamnagar,\nthe Andamans, Bahrain and Aden. &nbsp;Seventy\neight Naval ships and 20 shore Naval establishments, involving 20,000 Nany ratings\nwere affected.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">After the Second World\nWar was over, three of the top officers of the Indian National Army (INA) -\nGeneral Shah Nawaz Khan (Muslim), Colonel Prem Sehgal (Hindu) and Colonel\nGurbaksh Singh Dhillon (Sikh) were put on trial at the Red Fort in Delhi. &nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Their crime: \"waging war against the King\nEmperor\". Heeding to Netaji Subhash\u2019s Chandra Bose\u2019s call the INA has\njumped mid river from the British boat to the Japanese boat.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://4.bp.blogspot.com/-iW5RmDhxhJE/UR5zUd-3SrI/AAAAAAAAfKg/6BIt60ot3VM/s1600/nov_2_45.gif\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"640\" src=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-iW5RmDhxhJE/UR5zUd-3SrI/AAAAAAAAfKg/6BIt60ot3VM/s640/nov_2_45.gif\" width=\"612\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Digression:<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b>Gen Shah Nawaz&nbsp;Khan</b> of INA adopted\nLateef Fatima who was the mother of Bollywood megastar Shahrukh Khan .&nbsp;</span><br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://2.bp.blogspot.com/-ylBaaSREdOs/UR4X44-G_XI/AAAAAAAAfIw/tW-cPkFWObI/s1600/WDVV.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"320\" src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-ylBaaSREdOs/UR4X44-G_XI/AAAAAAAAfIw/tW-cPkFWObI/s320/WDVV.jpg\" width=\"236\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">One son\nof Shah Nawaz Khan Mahmood Nawaz, stayed on in Pakistan and became a full\ncolonel . ISI chief Lieutenant-General Zaheerul Islam is a nephew of Shah Nawaz\nKhan. &nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">By the way </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Maj Gen Isfandyar Ali Khan Pataudi, ( Saif Ali\nKhan\u2019s uncle ) </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">was a deputy director\ngeneral of ISI.</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://4.bp.blogspot.com/-TSGVsffQot4/USo0lcpubpI/AAAAAAAAf_w/Mv5DpAfEeV8/s1600/shahrukh-khan_saif-ali-khan___175140.JPG\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"247\" src=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-TSGVsffQot4/USo0lcpubpI/AAAAAAAAf_w/Mv5DpAfEeV8/s400/shahrukh-khan_saif-ali-khan___175140.JPG\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"color: red; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Every sentence the Bollywood Khans tell on TV is peppered with Allahs' galore.</i></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Getting back--<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Unprecedentedly, these\ntrials were very public, to strike terror into the hearts of the armed forces. &nbsp;Due to the sympathy toward Netaji and the INA\nin general, &nbsp;there was an instant and\nlarge outpouring of passion and patriotism in Indians. &nbsp;These stories were being shared via wireless\nsets and through media in general on the ships, where the sailors who were discriminated\nupon, got inspired to revolt.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Just 5 months after the\nWW2 got over, in January 1946,&nbsp; 2000\nBritish <b><span style=\"color: red;\">airmen</span></b> RAF Bamhrauli, Allahabad, India, went on strike. &nbsp;The war had\nended and down sizing was going on, and they felt insecure, as with their\nlimited qualifications no jobs would be available back home at England. .&nbsp; Some just wanted to go back to England, as\nthey had NOT seen their families for around 5 years..&nbsp;</span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This strike was quickly\nfollowed by the 2100 airmen at at Mauripur, Karachi and 1200 airmen at Dum Dum,\nCalcutta airfield, 1,200 men stopped work.&nbsp;\nSoon 4000 airmen at Seletar, Singapore, held massive parades to\ndemand the presence of the Supreme Allied Commander South East Asia.&nbsp; The strike then spread to Kanpur, Palam\n(Delhi), Poona, Vizagapatam, Allahabad, Dum Dum, Kallang, Seletar, Chakulia ,Lahore and\nNegombo .&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">On February 1st 1946, the Marshal of the Royal Air Force Sir John\nCotesworth (Jack) Slessor &nbsp;signaled to\nSir Keith Rodney Park , the Allied Air Commander, South-East Asia, and Sir\nRoderick Roderick Carr, Air Officer Commanding, India Command&nbsp; : \u201cThe only way of dealing with these\nincidents is to identify the ringleaders and deal with them immediately by\ncourt marshal--&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 115%;\">.not a single man will get out of the RAF one day\nearlier as a result of these mutinies</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;.\" .&nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In a speech to the\nHouse of Commons on 29 January, Prime Minister Attlee said that\n\"incidents\" had occurred at twelve RAF stations, but the Air Ministry\nlater adjusted this figurae and put it as 22 stations.&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Much later , according\nto a \"Secret History\" programme broadcast on Channel 4 in 1996, there\nwere strikes at more than 60 RAF units, with more than fifty thousand men\ninvolved. These \"incidents\", some lasting only a few hours, others up\nto four days, all took place within eleven days of the initial protest at Allahabad and Drigh\nRoad, Karachi.</span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</div>\n<br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This was the first strike in the history of the RAF, and all airmen were generally pissed off , with the HOT Indian summer around the corner .&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">The two largest British\nflag ships SS Queen Mary and SS Queen Elizabeth were being used to ferry GI Joe\nbrides from England to the USA , adding insult to injury.</span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 16px; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 16px; line-height: 150%;\">Just twelve days before the Indian Navy Mutiny ( which started on 18</span><sup style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; line-height: 150%;\">th</sup><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 16px; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;Feb 1946 ), &nbsp;600 members, including officers of the Royal Indian Air Force (RIAF) camp situated close by on Bombay Marine Drive went on a hunger strike as a protest against a racial insult by the Camp Commander.</span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The world war was finally over for good , the swollen forces were being\nrapidly down-sized, aviators, sailors and soldiers were being demobilized . Though there was a program to\nre-train men for civilian life, it was so symbolic so as to be meaningless.\nCoupled with the fact that most of the British Officers actually running the\nshow (de-mob program) were reservists, not careerists and they just could not\nconnect with the men under them- the men had no respect for them.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<span style=\"line-height: 24px;\">The Viceroy of India, General Wavell, held the RAF men guilty. Referring to the naval mutinies, he wrote, \"I am afraid that the example of the Royal Air Force, who got away with what was really mutiny, has some responsibility for the present situation\".</span><br />\n<span style=\"line-height: 24px;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Even today the British\nsay\u2014 see the stupid Indians had no idea how to revolt. &nbsp;They just mimicked us!&nbsp; Copy cats! &nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">On the quiet morning of\nFebruary 26, 1946, some 120 <b><span style=\"color: red;\">army men</span></b> of the 'J' company of the Signals Training\nCentre (STC),<b> Jabalpur</b>, defied their British superiors and broke free from\ntheir barracks, as an aftermath of the naval mutiny. &nbsp;Part of a radio signalling unit, they were sick\nand tired of the racist abuse heaped on them by their paranoid British\ncounterparts.&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The ranks of the mutineers\nswelled to 1,700 men, armed with nothing more than Congress and Muslim League\nflags. &nbsp;Shouting slogans, the patriotic\nmutineers protested peacefully for some days till a vicious bayonet charge by\nthe Somerset Light Infantry which killed 8 ring leaders ( and poked bleeding holes\nin 32 more) brought the mutiny to a grinding halt. Eighty men behind the mutiny\nwere court-martialled and dismissed without pay and pension. Forty-one others\nwere sent to prison. But the incident was quickly hushed up. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Jabalpur mutiny had\nthe British worried about what they took for granted \u2014the British Indian army's\nloyalty. &nbsp;In sharp contrast, the naval\nratings who mutinied just days ahead of the Jabalpur mutiny were recognised as\nfreedom fighters albeit late..&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Naval mutiny was officially recognised as\npart of the freedom struggle by the government of India. &nbsp;The men were allowed to serve in the navy of\nindependent India and retire with full pensionary benefits, pay and allowances.\n&nbsp;What's more, they were awarded special\nfreedom fighter's pensions. &nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">All that the\nmutineers of Jabalpur received for their efforts was a vicious bayonet charge, &nbsp;rigorous imprisonment and dismissal without\nbenefits. &nbsp;Even today we find old and\ndesparately poor Jabalpur &nbsp;army men\ninquiring on the Internet, if it is possible to get a pension.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">One of the reasons Gen\nVK Singh is being sidelined and his Z security withdrawn is due to his anti establishment book &nbsp;\u201cThe Contribution of the Indian Armed Forces\nto the Freedom Movement\u201d on the Jabalpur mutiny.&nbsp; &nbsp;In\n2002, when Gen VK Singh reopened dusty files of the Corps of Signals, and he\nchanced upon this forgotten chapter of the mutiny. &nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">He immediately took up the cause of getting\nthe mutiny recognised as a part of the freedom struggle. &nbsp;However, he only ran into the impenetrable wall\nof Indian bureaucracy. &nbsp;As letters flew\nbetween Singh, the directorate of signals, ministry of defence, and the\nministry of home affairs (MHA), the bureaucratic machinery and red tape continued\nto hold out.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Gen VK Singh took pains to point out to any babu who would care to\nhear him out that the Jabalpur men had been ignored while recognition had been\naccorded to the naval ratings &nbsp;who\nparticipated in the Royal Indian Navy mutiny, which ironically took place a\ncouple of weeks before the Jabalpur mutiny. &nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Meanwhile, one of the survivors of the mutiny,\nLance Naik Neelakantan Nair, went to the Kerala High Court seeking directions\nto the MHA. &nbsp;In July 2003, the court\ndirected the MHA and the state government to look into the matter and report\nback in six months. &nbsp;But nothing came of\nit. &nbsp;Finally, in a letter dated February\n14, 2003 (No 8/2/2003-FF-P), the MHA stated that the issue of granting freedom\nfighter status to the mutineers had been \"considered and it has been\ndecided at the level of the home minister that they cannot be treated as\nfreedom fighters.\" &nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Ironically, the\nnaval mutineers were also radio men just like the ones in Jabalpur. &nbsp;So why did the British hush up the Jabalpur army\nmen\u2019s &nbsp;mutiny? &nbsp;They feared trouble if the news of the revolt\nspread to other army units across British India. &nbsp;A year later, as independent India finally\nbecame a reality, the brave men of Jabalpur became a footnote in the forgotten\nrecords of the Corps of Signals. &nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Seeing\nthe Jabalpur and the navy mutiny of Bombay together, the British were worrying\nabout the probability of a larger insurrection, and literally getting fried for\ntheir past racial excesses . Therefore, when the men of the 'J' company stood\nin defiance, they made history\u2014this was the first and only major instance of\nIndian army regulars challenging the British. The steadfast loyalty of the\nBritish Indian army , was considered the backbone of British rule in India.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Jabalpur mutiny,\nthough lost to historians, left a deep irreversible impact on the British. &nbsp;The then commander-in-chief of the British\nIndian army, Gen Sir Claude Auchinleck, sent several secret cables back to\nLondon, discussing a quick transfer of power from British hands to the Indians.\n&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: red; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: large; line-height: 150%;\"><b>No army, no navy, no airforce, no\ncommunications, with police joining the strike was something the British\nnever ever expected.&nbsp;</b></span><br />\n<span style=\"color: red; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: large; line-height: 150%;\"><b><br /></b></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-I7l0sUUONoA/W8Gfh1tB8LI/AAAAAAABeqs/ETqokvgP_Pw0z0A-SF4eWq3-oj-HkvDQACLcBGAs/s1600/WWdownload.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"195\" data-original-width=\"259\" height=\"481\" src=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-I7l0sUUONoA/W8Gfh1tB8LI/AAAAAAABeqs/ETqokvgP_Pw0z0A-SF4eWq3-oj-HkvDQACLcBGAs/s640/WWdownload.jpg\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">British men and women\ngoing in cars and Victorias 203s horse carriages were made to get down remove\ntheir hats, and shout \"Jai Hind\" (Victory to India). </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Meanwhile\nthe navy's big guns were trained on the Taj Mahal Hotel, the Yacht Club and\nother British infested buildings from morning till evening.&nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Two naval ships were even\ncast off from the quay without British / Indian officers and engineers, taken\nfor a joy ride and anchored. And mind you, this was done by ratings alone, </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">and they did NOT have GPS or know how to use a sextant.</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Even the ever loyal &nbsp;Gurkhas had refused to fire on striking\nsailors.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">As Karunanidhi would\nhave summed up \u201c <i><b>Eppidi ethirpu naan\npaakavee illai</b></i>!\u201d . &nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">And on top of\nthat there was no Rothschild to conjure up \u201cinstant\u201d dirty tricks from their criminal\nDNA.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">It was to shatter this\nnew found Hindu Muslim unity that the British used their agents to bribe\nanti-social elements to start Hindu Muslim riots all over India. &nbsp;If you take\nstatistics there were more Indians killed in Hindu Muslim riots after March\n1946.</span> &nbsp;&nbsp;<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The casualty\nfigures in Calcutta alone during the period of 16-19 August were 4,100 dead and\n12,000 injured.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue; font-size: large;\"><b>The general &nbsp;writes, \"I saw what Gen Sir Claude\nAuchinleck wrote to the army commanders, worried that <span style=\"background-color: yellow;\">the loyalty of the Indian\ntroops couldn't be taken for granted anymore</span>. This had a profound impact on the\nBritish and probably quickened the departure of the British from India\". </b></span><span style=\"font-size: small;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://3.bp.blogspot.com/-SABKVt1mXGA/UR4nuqvJkuI/AAAAAAAAfJQ/rqXHeYuac5c/s1600/fghhj.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"216\" src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-SABKVt1mXGA/UR4nuqvJkuI/AAAAAAAAfJQ/rqXHeYuac5c/s320/fghhj.jpg\" width=\"320\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Gen VK continues, &nbsp;\"It is absurd. All the naval mutineers\nhave been recognised and feted by the government as freedom fighters. They too\nwere discharged on administrative grounds. But the same logic didn't hold true\nfor the men who suffered for decades for participating in the mutiny, for ironically,\nthe naval mutineers were also radiomen just like the ones in Jabalpur\u201d<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">So how did the Indian\nNavy mutiny shake up the foundations of the British empire?<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Unlike the army and air\nforce peaceful strike , &nbsp;this was a full\nblown mutiny. From the initial flashpoint in the signalman training ship Talwar , at Bombay, the revolt spread and\nfound support throughout British India, from Karachi to Calcutta and ultimately\ncame to involve 78 ships, 20 shore establishments and 20,000 sailors. &nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://3.bp.blogspot.com/-rYhmCDPwn8U/UR8AUI7dWwI/AAAAAAAAfLI/wcJHeLgvUbk/s1600/evt121114124300043.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"203\" src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-rYhmCDPwn8U/UR8AUI7dWwI/AAAAAAAAfLI/wcJHeLgvUbk/s640/evt121114124300043.jpg\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">It was repressed by\nforce by the British Royal Navy, using their white sailors and airforce.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">An annoyed Sardar\nVallabhai Patel &nbsp;summoned the ring leader\n&nbsp;Petty Officer Telegraphist&nbsp; Madan Singh in a flat at Bombay and literally\nshouted at him and demanded that he stop the mutiny. Cutting no ice, then &nbsp;Jawaharlal Nehru called Madan to his brother-in-law\nHuthee Singh\u2019s flat and tried sweet talk and cajoling .&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">T</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">he typical good man\nbad man psychology. </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Nehru lays the honey\nthick \"<i>Agar main bhi aap ki jagah hota to main bhi jazbaat mein beh\njaata</i>\".&nbsp; Nehru assured that there\nwould be no victimization, if the mutiny stopped and the culprits surrendered.\nMadan made it clear that the Navy will &nbsp;surrender only to Indian national leaders and\nnot to the British authorities. &nbsp;Despite Nehru\u2019s\nassurances , hundreds of Navy ratings &nbsp;were dismissed on the spot. &nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Patel issued a\nstatement calling on the strikers to end their action, which was later echoed\nby a statement issued in Calcutta by Mohammed Ali Jinnah on behalf of the\nMuslim League. Under these considerable pressures, &nbsp;the strikers gave way. British airplanes wree\nmaking show of strength low flights. Their naval ships from Ceylon manned with Canadians,\nAussies and New Zealanders arrived at the Gate way of Bombay. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Despite assurances from\nNehru and Jinnah widespread arrests were made by the British. Madan Singh himself\nwas placed in solitary confinement for three and a half months. There were\nseveral unilateral court martials. None of those dismissed were reinstated into\neither the Indian or Pakistani navies after independence.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Navymen had the wireless\nsystem under their control. &nbsp;They were\nable to &nbsp;win over almost all the 70 ships\nand all the 20 seashore establishments. &nbsp;They had secured control over the civilian\ntelephone exchange, the cable network and, above all, over the transmission\ncentre at Kirkee manned by the Navy, which was the channel of communication\nbetween the Indian Government and the British.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Hundreds were killed ,\nall this was hushed up Most of this happened when British tanks tried &nbsp;to smah through &nbsp;the barricades put up by civilians. &nbsp;Besides, there were some casualties even among\nus as a result of an exhange of fire between Indians and white British troops .\n&nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">On February 20 and 21, The navy men gave a call for a general strike which evoked &nbsp;tremendous public response. It was perceived\nas a challenge to the Queen\u2019s &nbsp;authority.\n&nbsp;Widespread rioting took place from\nKarachi to Calcutta, as the police did NOT report for work ..<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In Karachi, revolt\nbroke out on board the Royal Indian Navy ship, HMIS Hindustan off Manora\nIsland. The ship, as well as shore establishments were taken over by mutineers.\nLater, it spread to the HMIS Bahadur. The next day, ratings from Castle and\nFort Barracks in Bombay, joined in the revolt when rumours&nbsp; spread that HMIS Talwar's ratings had been\nfired upon.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Several Indian low rank\nnaval officers who opposed the strike and sided with the British were thrown\noff the ship by ratings. &nbsp;Soon, the\nmutineers ratings were joined by thousands of disgruntled naval ratings from\nBombay, Karachi, Cochin and Vizag. &nbsp;Communication\nbetween the various mutinies was maintained through the wireless communication\nsets available in HMIS Talwar. &nbsp;Thus, the\nentire revolt was coordinated in a marvelous manner . &nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The strike initiated by the naval ratings soon\ntook serious proportions.&nbsp; Hundreds of\nstrikers from the sloops, minesweepers and shore establishments in Bombay\ndemonstrated&nbsp; near VT .&nbsp; British personnel of the Defence forces were\nsingled out for attacks by the strikers who were armed with steel rods, hammers\nand even hockey sticks.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The White Ensign was lowered and discarded from the\nships. Passions spilt over. The naval canteens were raided and expensive stuff like champagne, premium Black label scotch whisky, caviar , Dunhill cigarettes etc meant only for the superior whites were distributed. &nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;;\"><span style=\"font-size: small;\"><span style=\"line-height: 150%;\">The white&nbsp;</span></span><span style=\"line-height: 24px;\">Christian</span><span style=\"font-size: small;\"><span style=\"line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;man first came as missionaries\nand traders , and then they took over by sheer cunning and dishonourable deceit. &nbsp;They had\nkilled millions of Indians- unrecorded and unsung.&nbsp;</span></span></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;;\"><span style=\"font-size: small;\"><span style=\"line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></span></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://3.bp.blogspot.com/-UzM81anaTAI/UR8BecwuF6I/AAAAAAAAfLU/PYpKw8VH2UU/s1600/images+%252810%2529.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"400\" src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-UzM81anaTAI/UR8BecwuF6I/AAAAAAAAfLU/PYpKw8VH2UU/s400/images+%252810%2529.jpg\" width=\"295\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">As retribution for the\nIndian soldiers ( INA ) jumping from British to the Japanese side, at Singapore, Winston Churchill ( whose Jewish mother Jenny Jerome was Rothschild blood ) <b><span style=\"color: red;\">starved to death 5.2 million</span></b>\nBengalis.</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span><br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://4.bp.blogspot.com/-W-DrXnPVuzQ/UR8BmCt-N_I/AAAAAAAAfLc/Q4H3VVOPCcU/s1600/imagesCAIIGZQR+(1).jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"307\" src=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-W-DrXnPVuzQ/UR8BmCt-N_I/AAAAAAAAfLc/Q4H3VVOPCcU/s400/imagesCAIIGZQR+(1).jpg\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n\n\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Punch into Google\nsearch <b><span style=\"color: red;\">AMARTYA SEN GETS NOBEL PRIZE FOR WHITEWASHING CHURCHILL'S INDIAN\nHOLOCAUST VADAKAYIL<o:p></o:p></span></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b><span style=\"color: red;\"><br /></span></b></span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://3.bp.blogspot.com/-EoOC6y7O-bY/UR8BphKJ2vI/AAAAAAAAfLk/dqvWtmsI5bA/s1600/xdghjk.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"428\" src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-EoOC6y7O-bY/UR8BphKJ2vI/AAAAAAAAfLk/dqvWtmsI5bA/s640/xdghjk.jpg\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://3.bp.blogspot.com/-jd_ctB8Vfi4/USz_CjhYUjI/AAAAAAAAgFg/n7QLjhdtGIo/s1600/sfghju.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"625\" src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-jd_ctB8Vfi4/USz_CjhYUjI/AAAAAAAAgFg/n7QLjhdtGIo/s640/sfghju.jpg\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://3.bp.blogspot.com/-N1nyfVLFsQ8/USz-6vGwCDI/AAAAAAAAgFY/szELkd06gzU/s1600/edcsa.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"449\" src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-N1nyfVLFsQ8/USz-6vGwCDI/AAAAAAAAgFY/szELkd06gzU/s640/edcsa.jpg\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Indian soldiers\ncausalities in both World Wars were recorded as white British soldier deaths.\nNo memorials were made for the brave Indians soldiers. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The 2nd World War\nshowed the true worth of the white English speaking soldiers \u2013 they were\ncowards. Indian soldiers had seen for themselves how a large and well armed\nBritish force capitulated like sissies - nay- pussies - to the lesser Japanese\nforces at Singapore and Burma.&nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://3.bp.blogspot.com/-XUJHGAuA8pg/UR7_1z6LxpI/AAAAAAAAfLA/yVI0sBeqCHY/s1600/ghj.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"248\" src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-XUJHGAuA8pg/UR7_1z6LxpI/AAAAAAAAfLA/yVI0sBeqCHY/s320/ghj.jpg\" width=\"320\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><o:p></o:p></span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">For all their self\nconferred bravery and toughness during bar brawls and soccer matches, the Indian soldiers saw that\nthese English speaking white men lacked the guts to spill their own blood in combat.</span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Clement Attlee, the\nBritish Prime Minister, breathing fire and brimstone ordered the Royal Navy to\nput down the revolt. &nbsp;He was most\nsurprised that Rothschild stooge Gandhi was no longer calling the shots in\nIndia. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Lord Pethik Lawrence\nmade a momentous declaration in the House of Lords on February 19, 1946 in\nwhich he announced the decision of the British government to send a special\nmission, consisting of himself, Sir Stratford Cripps and AV Alexander to\nresolve the constitutional dead-lock in India. This was the beginning of the\nend, the first nail in the coffin.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Navies of Australia ,\nCanada AND OTHER English speaking nations were summoned, to India on an\nemergency basis.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-xSJSGcESR2Y/UR9s7-vZgRI/AAAAAAAAfPU/GWq0deG7nUQ/s1600/3484662-thumbnail.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"400\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-xSJSGcESR2Y/UR9s7-vZgRI/AAAAAAAAfPU/GWq0deG7nUQ/s400/3484662-thumbnail.jpg\" width=\"320\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Admiral J.H. Godfrey,\nthe Flag Officer commanding the RIN, went on air with his order to \"Submit\nor perish\"\u2014and another Jallianwalah Bagh type massacre threat was made . The\nmutineers in the armed forces got zilch support from the national leaders ( not\neven covert ) &nbsp;and was largely leaderless.\n&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Sardar Vallabhai Patel declared\n\"They are a bunch of young hotheads, messing with things they had no\nbusiness with.\" &nbsp;&nbsp;His words are now deleted in history , as he\nhas to be propped up as the Iron man of India, right?.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">On the morning of\nFebruary 21, 1946 the white guards opened fire at the Indian ratings trying to\nescape from the castle Barracks and this transformed a peaceful mutiny into a\nviolent armed uprising. By this time the Strike Committee shifted command to\nthe RIN flagship Narba . The ratings in Calcutta, Madras, Karachi &nbsp;Vizag and other naval centres , also went on\nstrike with the slogans \"Strike for Bombay\", \"Release 11,000 INA\nprisoners\" and \"Jai Hind\".<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://4.bp.blogspot.com/-MCpSVfrnYnY/UR9uKggNK1I/AAAAAAAAfPg/PyUMCDae7PA/s1600/3484205-thumbnail+(1).jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"400\" src=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-MCpSVfrnYnY/UR9uKggNK1I/AAAAAAAAfPg/PyUMCDae7PA/s400/3484205-thumbnail+(1).jpg\" width=\"320\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">After regiments of the\nBritish army were deployed against the civilians in Bombay on February 22 and\n23 1946, the number of people killed rose above 300. &nbsp;All rebel ships manned guns, raised steam and\nbegan to hoot on the ship\u2019s whistle their intention of defending their comrades\non shore. The sheer noise which could be heard for miles around , unnerved all\nthe British.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;But this was a mutiny that received\nunprecedented passionate public support. &nbsp;They mutiny leaders had monopoly over the wireless\ncommunication sets and guns available in Mumbai and most other places. Thus,\nthe entire revolt was coordinated.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">By this time, all the\narmouries of the ships and establishments had been seized by the striking naval\nratings. &nbsp;The deck and engine hands, &nbsp;stewards, cooks and wireless operators of the\nstriking ship armed themselves with whatever weapon was available to resist the\nBritish destroyers that had sailed from Colombo and Trincomalee in Ceylon (Sri\nLanka). &nbsp;In Madras and Pune, the Indians\nin British army garrisons went on strike.. &nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Even the burhka-clad women of Bhendi Bazaar\nand Dongri , &nbsp;joined in the agitation\nthrowing hot water and &nbsp;pans, from the\nroof tops, &nbsp;at the white British soldiers\nwho were called out to patrol the streets for a show of strength. &nbsp;These same women showered flowers on the\nIndian muntineers and public who were resisting. &nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">BLPI members Prabhakar More and Lakshman\nJadhav led 3 lakhs of unionized textile mill workers out on strike.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The other navy\nrating members chosen in the mutiny leadership committee , were Leading\nSignaller Bedi Basant Singh, S.C. Sen Gupta, Chief Petty Officer, School Master\nNawaz, Leading Seaman Ashraf Khan, Able Stoker Gomez and Mohammad Hussain.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://3.bp.blogspot.com/-nTNsygKeXhI/UR9uPgsXSRI/AAAAAAAAfPo/F4Xyv9OoUAU/s1600/3485051-thumbnail.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"400\" src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-nTNsygKeXhI/UR9uPgsXSRI/AAAAAAAAfPo/F4Xyv9OoUAU/s400/3485051-thumbnail.jpg\" width=\"320\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The situation was\nchanging fast and rumours spread that white Australian and Canadian armed\nbattalions had been stationed outside the Lion gate and the Gun gate to\nencircle the dockyard where most ships were berthed.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The ratings in a\nprocession passed through the streets of Manora, shouting anti-British slogans.\nThey were joined by the inhabitants of Manora. When the ratings in boats moved\ntowards the ship Hindustan, the General of the Army sent two platoons of Baluch\nsoldiers to suppress the revolt. When the Baluch refused to fire upon their\nbrothers, the British authorities got panicky. Then the White troops were\nsummoned and Hindustan was surrounded from all sides.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The British troops\nstarted firing and the &nbsp;ratings on\nHindustan retaliated. The firing and attacks and counter-attacks continued for\nfour hours. Six of the ratings were killed, more than 30 were wounded.&nbsp; &nbsp;Karachi witnessed complete hartal (strike).&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">More than 35,000 people, Hindus and Muslims\u2014gathered at Idgah defying Section\n144 which had been imposed by the authorities. To disperse the crowd, the\npolice resorted to firing. &nbsp;More than 50\nwere &nbsp;wounded.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">120,000 &nbsp;lakh people at Calcutta on the call of the CPI\njoined the strike. It continued till the 25th Feb 1946, when the British with\ntheir full armed might surrounded the ratings . Many were killed and wounded . &nbsp;Almost all Indian cities witnessed hartals.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The negotiations moved\nfast, keeping in view the extreme sensitivity of the situation and on the\nfourth day 22<sup>nd</sup> Feb 1946,&nbsp; most\nof the demands of the strikers were conceded in principle. On February 23,\nleading seaman M S Khan, president of the Naval Central Strike Committee,\nannounced: \u201c<i>Our strike has been a historic event in the life of our nation. For\nthe first time the blood of the men in the services and the people flowed\ntogether in a common cause. We will never forget this. Jai Hind!</i>\u201d<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">At 0600 hrs on February\n24, 1946 white flags were raised from the decks of all ships to announce\nsurrender.&nbsp; In its last session the\nstrike committee passed a resolution which stated, \"<i>Our uprising was an\nimportant historical event in the lives of our people. For the first time the\nblood of uniformed and non-uniformed workers flowed in one current for the same\ncollective cause. We the workers in uniform shall never forget this. We also\nknow that you, our proletarian brothers and sisters shall also never forget\nthis. The coming generations, learning its lessons shall accomplish what we\nhave not been able to achieve. Long live the working masses.
