, &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">All the above eight children of\nMaharaja Duleep Singh died without children, &nbsp;(which is astonishing and quite mysterious), &nbsp;ending the direct line of the Sikh Royalty. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b><span style=\"color: blue;\">WHEN A INDIAN YUV-RAJ IN\nWAITING MARRIES A WHITE CHRISTIAN FOREIGNER OUT OF LOVE ( SIC) , &nbsp;IN A FOREIGN LAND , IT IS USUALLY MADE TO\nHAPPEN, &nbsp;BY POWERFUL FORCES. &nbsp;</span></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b><br /></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b><span style=\"color: red;\">SUCH A WOMAN IS CALLED A HONEY POT. ( KNOW OF\nANY SUCH &nbsp;RECENT &nbsp;LIVING HONEY POT &nbsp;?!?) </span></b><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">And Maharaja Duleep\nSingh is allegedly NOT Ranjit Singh\u2019s biological child..&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">Below: Maharaja Duleep Singh &nbsp;</span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://2.bp.blogspot.com/-RPWlBPfK75U/URi2BohMERI/AAAAAAAAeuM/WnEsSdPXsi0/s1600/lahore-Duleep.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"640\" src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-RPWlBPfK75U/URi2BohMERI/AAAAAAAAeuM/WnEsSdPXsi0/s640/lahore-Duleep.jpg\" width=\"262\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Maharaja Ranjit Singh , who just recovered\nfrom his 3<sup>rd</sup> stroke , was paralysed below the waist, and was NOT in\na any prime physical condition to have a boner and penetrate and seed Rani\nJindan Kaur , when Duleep Singh was conceived, as per his doctor. &nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">His attractive mother\n<b>Maharani Jindan Kaur</b> was accused of having a torrid affair with the handsome Raja Lal\nSingh, behind Ranjit Singh\u2019s back. &nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">Below-Jindan Kaur</span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://2.bp.blogspot.com/-WncVfeh8DKI/URi13gTRDDI/AAAAAAAAeuE/prWX7xwM0tc/s1600/maharani-jindan-kaur-last-wife-of-ranjeet-singh.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"320\" src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-WncVfeh8DKI/URi13gTRDDI/AAAAAAAAeuE/prWX7xwM0tc/s320/maharani-jindan-kaur-last-wife-of-ranjeet-singh.jpg\" width=\"234\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Maharani &nbsp;Jindan Kaur, did NOT have royal blood.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">She was\nthe daughter of Sardar Manna Singh Aulak, the Royal Kennel Keeper at the Court\nof Lahore. She was the ninth and the last regular wife he married, according to\nSikh customs in 1835, and who bore him his last son Duleep Singh ( sic ) &nbsp;in 1838, just 10 months before his death in\n1839. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The British called her\nthe Messalina of the Punjab--&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">comparing her to\nMessalina, the wife of the Roman Emperor, Claudius, who was a wanton and licentious\nseductress</span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Manna used to perch his pretty girl child Jindan kaur on his shoulder, and run alongside the\nMaharaja\u2019s palki. &nbsp;He &nbsp;used to joke with Ranjit Singh, &nbsp;whenever ever he saw him ogling his attractive\nbut underage daughter &nbsp;\u201c Sir, when will you\nmarry my daughter and make her your queen?\u201d<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">One day to his utter surprise\nRanjit Singh relied &nbsp;\u201cVery well, bring\nher to my palace !\u201d &nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">She made all the\nother women of Ranjit Singh very jealous. &nbsp;Till the age of 13, his Prime minister Dhian\nSingh was in charge of her. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In the Memoirs of\nAlexander Gardner\u201d&nbsp; Ranjit Singh took\nJindan into his harem where the little smouldering beauty used to gambol, and\nfrolic and tease and captivated the Maharaja in a way that smote the real wives\nwith jealousy.&nbsp;&nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In 1830, with the object\nof calming the jealousy of his wives, the Maharaja sent Jindan, then thirteen,\nto her godfather at Amritsar where her \"amorous flirtatious glances and\ncoquettish pranks continued attracting lustful attentions of no small number of\nerotic truants\u201d.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A lot\nof Sikhs are very proud of this Maharani-- whose shady history is alleged to be a pack of lies. &nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b>Lal Singh</b> was a Brahmin from Jhelum and entered\nthe service of the Sikh Darbar in 1832 as a lowly writer in the treasury, &nbsp;on the recommendation of the Dogra Prime\nminister Dhian Singh. &nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">Below - Lal Singh&nbsp;</span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://3.bp.blogspot.com/-eV0Amxe-a08/URi1iWoO1fI/AAAAAAAAet8/Wuer4PQe2ow/s1600/300px-Lalsingh.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"244\" src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-eV0Amxe-a08/URi1iWoO1fI/AAAAAAAAet8/Wuer4PQe2ow/s320/300px-Lalsingh.jpg\" width=\"320\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">It is alleged that in December 1844, Maharani\nJindan Kaur broke all pretense and appointed her lover Lal Singh &nbsp;as a member of the\nCouncil of Regency under her. &nbsp;He was\nmade Wazir on 8 November 1845. &nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">He was also personally teaching his own son Duleep\nSingh, as per his mother Jindan Kaur\u2019s her wishes.&nbsp; Lal Singh had designs for his son to be the future\nemperor of Punjab and Kashmir, and hence he mollycoddled the British, who used\nhim like the proverbial curry leaf .. &nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">One\nfine day he got careless and the British caught him . &nbsp;They found his letter giving secret\ninstructions to Shaikh Imam ud Din, the governor of Kashmir, to thwart the\noccupation by Gulab Singh Dogra ( &nbsp;brother of Dhian Singh ) of the valley granted him by the British under\na treaty signed on 16 March 1846. &nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">Below : Gulab Singh Dogra&nbsp;</span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\"><br /></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-Gp76RbAKvS4/URi8YocOlRI/AAAAAAAAevw/x5UE3KV7oSg/s1600/gulab+singh.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"400\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-Gp76RbAKvS4/URi8YocOlRI/AAAAAAAAevw/x5UE3KV7oSg/s400/gulab+singh.jpg\" width=\"325\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Lal\nSingh was formally tried by a British Court of Inquiry and found guilty. He was\nremoved from his high office and expelled from the Punjab with a pension of\n12,000 rupees per annum. &nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">He was sent to\nAgra and then to Dehra Dun, where he died in 1866.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">I will NOT eulogize Ranjit\nSingh, but will attempt to shed true light. &nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">As a child Ranjit Singh\nsuffered from smallpox as a child which resulted in the loss of one eye, and\nhis face was deeply pitted , and it was NOT a pretty sight. &nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">He was also a short man, considering Sikhs are\ntall and huge people. &nbsp;But was was\nextremely athletic and fast. &nbsp;He was &nbsp;uneducated, could neither read nor write, but\nhad a marvellous memory. &nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">He was a born leader\nand evoked intense loyalty among his subjects and his army consisting of Sikhs,\nRajputs, Hindus and Muslims. He never admitted the possibility of failure, and\nhence held the \"awe factor\".<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Ranjit Singh\u2019s father\nMahan Singh rose to head the Sukerchakya Misl and by marrying Raj Kaur, daughter\nof Chief of Jind, Gajpat Singh, made a powerful alliance.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Ranjeet Singh saw\naction at the battle front, when he was hardly 12 years old, when he\naccompanied his father Mahan Singh on a campaign. &nbsp;During the long siege Mahan Singh fell\nseriously ill, and knowing very well that his end was approaching, anointed his\nson Ranjeet Singh as his successor and chief of the Sukerchakia Misl, &nbsp;by applying saffron paste on his forehead. &nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The army of Sukerchakia\nMisl commanded by young Ranjeet Singh, &nbsp;achieving an astonishing victory against all\nodds, that amazed everybody. &nbsp;The news of\nthe sons victory reached the ailing Mahan Singh who heaved a sigh of relief\njust before he breathed his last in 1792. . &nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Once while on a hunting\nexpedition, Ranjit Singh was attacked by one of his father's enemies Hashmat\nKhan, who had old scores to settle with his father. Out of fear Ranjeet Singh's\nhorse stopped in its tracks, and Khan took the opportunity and wounded Ranjit\nSingh with his sword. In spite of being wounded Ranjeet Singh moved like greased\nlightning and with a powerful stroke of his sword cut off Khan's head. &nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">13 year old Ranjeet\nSingh then picked up the severed head of Hashmat Khan with his spear while on\nhorse back \u2013 and this was a tale while would be told a million times from a\nthousand lips. &nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Much later he would\ndemonstrate his prowess in \u201ctent pegging\u201d to the British ladies , ( on popular\nrequest ) , by making a soldier hold a lime in his palm. He galloped past at full\nspeed and speared the tiny lime with the sharp tip of his long spear. &nbsp;All noted that the soldier\u2019s palm was\nunharmed, &nbsp;nor was he in a state of fear. The horse was literally an extension of his body.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; line-height: 150%; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://2.bp.blogspot.com/-lKXhOnWxlTo/URkSx0S594I/AAAAAAAAew0/3n1BUeRoYGs/s1600/dfyuu.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"400\" src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-lKXhOnWxlTo/URkSx0S594I/AAAAAAAAew0/3n1BUeRoYGs/s400/dfyuu.jpg\" width=\"295\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Thus Ranjeet Singh had\ndemonstrated his prowess as an excellent horseman and skilled fighter at a\nrelatively young age, and his fame spread far and wide. He was a master in guerilla\ntactics, night attacks with very little men , pursuing&nbsp;withdrawing forces, and &nbsp;inflicting crushing and morale shattering defeats.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Maharaja Ranjit Singh\nis included in the list of \"Undefeated Military Commanders\"<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Ranjit Singh mobilized\nan army of 25,000 men that included Sikhs, Hindus as well as Muslims, and\nmarched towards Lahore .&nbsp; In the morning\nof July 7, 1799, Ranjeet Singh breached the&nbsp;\nwalls of the city, and occupied a large part of it without any\nresistance.&nbsp; The Afghan forces and their\nallies either surrendered or were killed.&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Immediately after taking possession of the city, Ranjeet Singh paid an\nvisit to the Badshahi Mosque, to pay his respects, a gesture that won the\nhearts of the Muslims of the City. Thus Ranjeet Singh at the age of 21 was\ncrowned the Maharajah of the Punjab on April 12, 1801. The coronation being\nconducted by Sahib Singh Bedi, a descendant of Guru Nanak Dev, the founder of\nthe Sikh religion.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Ranjit Singh made Lahore the capital of his kingdom. In\n1802, he took control of the holy city of Amritsar. The following years he\nspent fighting the Afghans and driving them out of the Punjab. He then embarked\non a campaign of conquest, capturing Pashtun territory that included Peshawar,\nthe province of Multan in southern Punjab, Jammu and Kashmir, and the hill\nstates north of Anandpur Sahib, the largest of which was&nbsp; Kangra.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">He extended his territories upto\nLadakh and China. Maharajah Ranjeet Singh was a devout Sikh, but opted for a\nsecular form of government where equal opportunities were provided for all\nirrespective of religion<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The maharajah had a\nharem of 46 wives. These could &nbsp;be\nsegregated into 4 classes. &nbsp;Firstly &nbsp;9 of his wives he had married in the orthodox\nSikh manner. These wives were considered a cut above other wives. Ranjit Singh\nalso married 9 rich widows by what in Sikh custom is called casting the Chaddar\n( blanket) over them.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Chaddar is a peculiar custom in the Punjab where a\nwidow is married to the man who casts a \u2018Chaddar\u2019 on the woman after which she\nbecomes his wife. &nbsp;Ranjit had 9 such attractive\nwidows as wives. &nbsp;He also had a third\ncategory of courtesan wives who were all Muslim. . The remaining were gorgeous women\nwhom he had fancied and were concubines. Fakir Nuruddin, the Home Minister, was\n&nbsp;incharge of Maharaja\u2019s palaces and the\nharem.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Maharajah was not\naverse to going to war to capture a beautiful woman or princess. In 1804 he\nlearnt of the beauty of 2 daughters Guddan and Raj Banso &nbsp;of Raja Sansar Chand of Kangra. &nbsp;He wished to marry them and sent his marriage\nproposal.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Raja turned it down as he could not agree both his daughters\nmarrying the same man\u2014and that too ugly by Rajput standards. &nbsp;Ranjit mounted an expedition and defeated Raja\nSansar Chand. &nbsp;He married both the\nprincesses at Jwalalmukhi, a holy place 30 km from Kangra.&nbsp; Jwalalmukhi has one of the most holy temples\nof Hinduism dedicated to the \u2018Goddess of Light. &nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Ranjit Singh spent the wedding night servicing\nthese two girls on the same bed till morning, fortified with aphrodisiacs. &nbsp;Guddan and Rani Raj Banso, the daughters of\nRaja Sansar Chand were the most stately , dignified and charming women in the\nMaharajah's entire harem.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Much later one of these\nRajput sisters , Maharani Mahtab Devi Sahiba ( Guddan ) who refused to marry this\nugly pock faced man , &nbsp;would hold his\nhead in her lap and calmly burn herself ( sati ) on her husband\u2019s , Ranjit\nSingh\u2019s funeral pyre. &nbsp;Eleven of his\nwives would burn themselves. &nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">His\nyoungest wife, who was also his 9th regular wife, Maharani Jindan Kaur did not\ncommit Sati, &nbsp;saying she had a 10-month\nold baby Duleep Singh to feed and look after. &nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Probably she had future royal designs for him\n.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">One of the dancing girls girls called Kaulan (Lotus) was given seven villages\nas jagir, but despite this wealth she was one of the ladies who committed sati\non Ranjit Singh\u2019s pyre.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Today, the ashes of\nthese eleven wives are placed in tiny urns, surrounding the large marble urn,\nin the shape of a lotus, containing Maharajah Ranjeet Singh's ashes, in the\ncenter of the tomb, the Samadhi of Ranjeet Singh, at Lahore.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://3.bp.blogspot.com/-DNnI3WmEIGM/URtASW6eHLI/AAAAAAAAe4Q/m78hALRMFic/s1600/castle_20236.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"313\" src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-DNnI3WmEIGM/URtASW6eHLI/AAAAAAAAe4Q/m78hALRMFic/s400/castle_20236.jpg\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Ranjit was also fond of\ndance and music. He had collected a troupe of 125 dancing girls from his\nkingdom as dancers. The girls were chosen from about the age of 14-16 and\nretired at 25 after which they were given to the courtiers of Ranjit Singh or\nthe foreign generals who served in Ranjit\u2019s army as a reward. The favorite\ngirls dancer was a drop dead beautiful girl named \u2018Billoo\u2019 ( Bashiran ) who\nRanjit loved passionately because of her blue eyes. &nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Carried away by the\nlifestyle of Lahore, the mercenary Jewish Italian General Jean Baptist Ventura,\none of the foreign commanders of Ranjit Singh\u2019s army, too kept 50 dancing\ngirls! &nbsp;The elite of the \u2018Lahore Darbar\u2019\nall were measured by the quality of their harem, for it depicted their power\nand prestige. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The sheer number of\ncourtesans in Lahore in the Sikh era has never been rivalled. They were\ninterested in the arts, in music, in the finest things in life. With the coming\nof the British, bringing women to sell in Lahore was banned and all women\nliving outside the wedlock as courtesans and keeps were asked to leave the\ncity. Many then decided to marry their masters.&nbsp;\n<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Ranjit Singh had heard\nof a legendary horse named As-i-Leila. This horse belonged to Dost Mohammed or\nYaar Mohammed who were the chiefs of the Orakazi Muslim tribes. The horse was a\nblack stallion of Persian origin. When Ranjit Singh heard of the horse he\ndemanded it from Yaar Mohammed. On his refusal he ordered General Jean Baptist\nVentura to mount an offensive against the Tribes.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In 1830 Yaar Mohammed was\ndefeated by Ventura who threatened to behead him in case the horse was not\nhanded over to his lord and Master Ranjit Singh. Later Yar Mohammed himself was\nkilled by his tribesmen and Ranjit Singh anointed his brother as the chief. The\nhorse was carried to Lahore in a special wagon and escorted by a large\ncontingent of him Sikh army<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">One of Ranjit Singh\u2019s favoured\nqueens, was Moran, ( Gul Bahar begum ) a dancing girl of Amritsar, with whom he\nfell passionately in love at first sight when he was just twenty-two in 1832..&nbsp; Ranjit Singh accepted all the conditions\nof&nbsp; Moran\u2019s father to marry her as per\ncustom of the courtesan\u2019s family.&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Moran\nhad had danced before British Governor General, Lord William Bentinck, at Ropar\nin October 1831. &nbsp;&nbsp;She rode with the Maharaja on the same\nelephant, sat in the darbar without veil , while she fondled Ranjit Singh..&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Ranjit Singh went to see Moran on arrival in Amritsar,\nrather than first paying his respects at the Darbar Sabib, as a consequence of\nwhich he had to face the wrath of the jathedar of the Akal Takht.</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; line-height: 150%; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://2.bp.blogspot.com/-CBY8Itsr1aA/URkpZKCueiI/AAAAAAAAexg/2x4OGTW21pI/s1600/imagesgjk.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"221\" src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-CBY8Itsr1aA/URkpZKCueiI/AAAAAAAAexg/2x4OGTW21pI/s400/imagesgjk.jpg\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">He subsequently visited the Golden Temple in\nan act of contrition for marrying a lady whose status did not match his own.</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp; </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Akali\nPhula Singh reprimanded Maharaja Ranjit Singh and he presented himself at the\nAkal Takhat to receive the \u2018tankhah\u2019 imposed by the Jathedar, by baring his\nback to receive the lashes.</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; line-height: 150%; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://3.bp.blogspot.com/-yHRqT2K5ldU/URkpfDdJvXI/AAAAAAAAexo/CX37W1-dL2E/s1600/imagesfguuo;.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"298\" src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-yHRqT2K5ldU/URkpfDdJvXI/AAAAAAAAexo/CX37W1-dL2E/s400/imagesfguuo;.jpg\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Much later the\nBritish agents of Rothschild operating in Lahore in those days chose to operated\nthrough Moran , causing him 4 strokes , the last one final. </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Unfortunately Ranjit Singh never suspected\nMoran and even got gold coins struck in her name, samples of which can be seen\neven today in the Lahore Museum.. She had the ability to extract state secrets\nfrom Ranjit Singh while having sex.</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">When Moran died, the Ranjit\nSingh decided to favour another courtesan by the name of Jugnoo Begum. She was\na very beautiful woman, but did not have the wit of Mooran, and soon the\nmaharaja found her boring. He then found another beauty from Amritsar, a woman\nMoran had once predicted would win his heart one day. &nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Her name was Gul Begum, and the proud Gul\ndemanded that he not touch her before he walked bare-foot from Lahore to\nAmritsar to wed her. The maharaja knew well that she would not bend, and so he\ndid as Gul Begum had demanded. &nbsp;It was\nGul Begum who looked after the maharaja when he fell ill. &nbsp;She smiled as she sat in the pyre in which Ranjit Singh was cremated. So looks like his barefoot walk did some magic.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">His consumption of\nalcohol mixed with crushed pearls was excessive and would contribute to his\nearly death. &nbsp;Emily Eden (sister of Lord\nAuckland, the then governor general of India) wrote, \u201cRanjit produced some of\nhis wine, a sort of liquid fire, that none of our strong spirits approach and,\nin general, Europeans cannot swallow more than a drop of it.\u201d<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Among the more\nimportant of his regular wives married according to Sikh customs, were Mehtab\nKaur of the Kanhia Misl, the daughter of Rani Sada Kaur, whom he married, when\nhe was 16 years old, in the year 1796.&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Rani Mehtab Kaur gave birth to three sons; the eldest Ishar Singh died\nyoung at 1\u00bdyears of age. The second and third sons were twins, Sher Singh and\nTara Singh. &nbsp;Sher Singh was the strongest claimant to the throne after Maharajah\nRanjeet Singh, being the eldest surviving son of the senior most wife of the\nking. &nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Ranjit Singh\u2019s mother did NOT get\nalong with the mother ( Sada Kaur ) of his wife Mehtab Kaur. &nbsp;Mehtab Kaur was a vain and haughty woman. &nbsp;Sada Kaur took her daughter Mehtab Kaur away\nwith her, where two princes Sher Singh and Tara Singh were born, who thus lived\naway from their father.&nbsp; Ranjit Singh\nkilled his mother on sensing infidelity to his dead father. Nobody writes or\ntalks about this.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">His second wife was Raj\nKaur of Nakai Misl, the daughter of Khazan Singh Nakai, whom he married in\n1798, at the age of 18 years. &nbsp;Rani Raj\nKaur gave birth to a son Kharak Singh in 1801 who became the heir-apparent to\nMaharajah Ranjeet Singh, being the Maharajah's eldest son.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Prince Kharak Singh\nwas &nbsp;was utterly lacking in ambition and\nworldly sense. Though he was trained as heir-apparent and was sent on some\nmilitary expeditions, his real interest lay in reading the Granth and sitting\nin the company of holy men. On top of that he was addicted to Opium.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Ranjit Singh\u2019s\npassionate love for horses can be judged from the fact that he had more than\n1200 horses in his stable, 1000 reserved for him personally. Riding was his\nfavourite exercise. Whenever he was burdened with private or state matters, he\nwould abruptly call for a horse, saddled, bridled and go for a long ride. The\nvanity he lacked about his own appearance was made up in appearance of his\nhorses. They were decked in most expensive and gorgeous trappings.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; line-height: 150%; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://4.bp.blogspot.com/-PI437fQbL0A/URkolYwlr_I/AAAAAAAAexI/OaUIekWIkEo/s1600/imageshjkl.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"187\" src=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-PI437fQbL0A/URkolYwlr_I/AAAAAAAAexI/OaUIekWIkEo/s320/imageshjkl.jpg\" width=\"320\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Famous were\nGauharbar, Sufaid Pari, Laili \u2013 all of Persian breed. There is a fairy\ntale-like story about Laili for which many expeditions were made and it cost him\nsixty lakhs of rupees and 1200 soldiers! &nbsp;He used to take pride of this possession and\nexhibit to his foreign visitors.</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 16px; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><o:p></o:p></span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 16px; line-height: 150%;\">Another marvel was his bungalow on wheels \u2013 decorated, furnished and pulled by eight mighty and richly caparisoned elephants.</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">One of these horses\nwould be his undoing. His Jewish Romanian chemist,<b> Dr. John Martin Honigberger</b> ,\n&nbsp;who was responsible for mixing his gunpowder,\ninfected the leg of his favourite horse causing an ulcer.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<i><span style=\"color: blue;\"><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Below:&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 16px; line-height: 150%;\">Honigberger</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 16px; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span></span></i></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; line-height: 150%; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-nOvuxH-zAas/URkpFkZTp2I/AAAAAAAAexY/we0MWIDGwiQ/s1600/john-martin-honigberger1.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"200\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-nOvuxH-zAas/URkpFkZTp2I/AAAAAAAAexY/we0MWIDGwiQ/s200/john-martin-honigberger1.jpg\" width=\"143\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">He got into the good\nbooks of Ranjit Singh by offering to cure the horse and injected the anti-dote of\nwhatever he had infected the leg with. Later he assumed the role of Ranjit\nSingh\u2019s personal doctor. He was responsible for preparing all these aphrodisiac\npotions with crushed pearls . He treated the Maharaja by dispensing \u201cDulcamara\u201d\nin wine and galvanic cell electric shocks.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This Romanian Jew was\nan agent of Rothschild. &nbsp;&nbsp;He took his orders from Rothschild\u2019s personal\nhomeopathy doctor, the German Jew <b>Dr&nbsp;Friedrich Samuel Hahnemann</b>, who is known as \u201cthe\nfather of Homeopathy\u201d ( sic ). &nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">Below:- Hahnemann</span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; line-height: 150%; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-LfZJOt6FLYA/URko10uGVkI/AAAAAAAAexQ/CJA6-WAjmrU/s1600/Hahnemann.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"400\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-LfZJOt6FLYA/URko10uGVkI/AAAAAAAAexQ/CJA6-WAjmrU/s400/Hahnemann.jpg\" width=\"299\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Dr. John\nMartin Honigberger had scrounged around in India for ancient vedic homeopathy texts\n, which he delivered to his boss in Paris in 1834. The fact that water holds\nmemory is written in our vedic texts . &nbsp;What the hell is \u201ctirtham\u201d and the holy water in a Maharishi's lota? <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Following the July\nRevolution of 1830 that saw Louis Philippe come to power in France , James de\nRothschild put together the loan package to stabilize the finances of the new\ngovernment and a huge second banking loan in 1834\u2014 all wealth stolen from India.&nbsp; In gratitude for his services to the nation,\nLouis Philippe elevated him to a grand officer of the Legion of Honor.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\nHere is the golden throne of Ranjit Singh. He was a simple man and did NOT sit on it too often. Even when he sat on it, it was in a cross legged fashion.<br />\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; line-height: 150%; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://3.bp.blogspot.com/-gcUIG9PECd0/URmxN1LXeYI/AAAAAAAAeyI/x3BrQJJf3ro/s1600/throne-of-maharajah-ranjeet-singh.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"342\" src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-gcUIG9PECd0/URmxN1LXeYI/AAAAAAAAeyI/x3BrQJJf3ro/s400/throne-of-maharajah-ranjeet-singh.jpg\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Ranjit singh was led\ninto the Treaty of Amritsar in 1809, &nbsp;by\nRothschild.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The British though they\nwere being very smart.&nbsp; They would make\nthe fierce Ranjit Singh\u2019s Sikh kingdom of Punjab act as a buffer between the\nmarauding Muslims of Afghanistan and themselves.&nbsp; They would allow his to vacuum and squirrel\naway wealth from the Mughal remnants \u2013a long and dirty job. And one fine day\nRothschild would swipe away this nice heap of wealth\u2014just like what they did to\nTipu Sultan in 1799.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">In between Rothschild\u2019s\nFrench Generals would hold the key member of the Sikh darbar in their vice\ngrip, by bribes , as their hidden agents.</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Maharaja Ranjit Singh\nout thought the British. This is why this man must be admired..<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">He knew that as long as\nthe Sikhs, Rajputs, Hindus and Muslims people bond together \u2013without the British\nplaying dirty \u201cdivide and rule\u201d tactics , as they did in the rest of India, he\nwould be just fine. His army would be too hard to beat, in a one on one fight. &nbsp;To keep the bonding alive he treated Sikhs, Muslims,\nRajputs and Hindus subjects alike. He never discriminated. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">So he agreed to sign\nthe Treaty of Amritsar of 1809. This would be an insurance policy as far as British\nattacks were concerned.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This treaty was signed\nby Mr. Charles Theophilus Metcalfe on behalf of British Government , whose\nGovernor General was Lord Minto , and Maharaja Ranjit Singh at Amritsar on\nApril 25, 1809. &nbsp;Charles Theophilus\nMetcalfe was born in Calcutta in January 1785 and he was the son of Thomas\nTheophilus Metcalfe who was appointed by Rothschild as the Director of the\nBritish East India Company.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">Below: Charles Metcalfe</span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; line-height: 150%; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://3.bp.blogspot.com/-w274jS3kGW4/URnJ8hUXprI/AAAAAAAAeyc/Ypv7FcpHrz4/s1600/220px-Charles_Theophilus_Metcalfe,_1st_Baron_Metcalfe_by_George_Chinnery.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"320\" src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-w274jS3kGW4/URnJ8hUXprI/AAAAAAAAeyc/Ypv7FcpHrz4/s320/220px-Charles_Theophilus_Metcalfe,_1st_Baron_Metcalfe_by_George_Chinnery.jpg\" width=\"243\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">He was only 23 years old when he was appointed\nenvoy to the court of Maharajah Ranjit Singh, as Rothchild\u2019s hawk\u2019s eye. This\nwas a very young age to be given such a huge responsibility. Later in life\nCharles Metcalfe would be acting Governor-General of India.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\">The Text of the\nTreaty:Treaty with the Rajah of Lahore - 1809<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\">Whereas certain\ndifferences which had arisen between the British Government and the Rajah of\nLahore have been happily and amicably adjusted, and both parties being anxious\nto maintain the relations of perfect amity and-concord, the following Articles\nof treaty, which shall be binding on the heirs and successors of the two\nparties, have been concluded by Rajah Runjeet Sing on his own part, and by the\nagency of Charles Theophilus Metcalfe, Esquire, on the part of the British\nGovernment. <o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\">Article 1. Perpetual\nfriendship shall subsist between the British Government and the State of\nLahore. The latter shall be considered, with respect to the former, to be on\nthe footing of the most favoured powers; and the British Government will have\nno concern with the territories and subjects of the Rajah to the northward of\nthe Sutlej.<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\"><span style=\"font-size: small;\"><span style=\"line-height: 150%;\">Article 2. The Rajah\nwill never maintain in the territory occupied by him and his&nbsp;</span></span><span style=\"line-height: 24px;\">dependents</span><span style=\"font-size: small;\"><span style=\"line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;.on the\nleft bank of the River Sutlej, more troops than are necessary for the internal\nduties of that territory, nor commit or suffer any encroachments on the\npossessions or rights of the Chiefs in its vicinity.<o:p></o:p></span></span></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\">Article 3. In the event\nof a violation of any of the preceding Articles, <o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\">or of a departure from\nthe rules of friendship on the part of either State, this Treaty shall be\nconsidered to be null and void.<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\">Article 4. This Treaty,\nconsisting of four Articles, having been settled and concluded at Amritsar, on\nthe 25th day of April, 1809, Mr. Charles Theophilus Metcalfe has delivered to\nthe Rajah of Lahore a copy of the same, in English and Persian, under his seal\nand signature, and the said Rajah has delivered another copy of the same, under\nhis seal and signature; and Mr. Charles Theophilus Metcalfe engages to procure,\nwithin the space of two months, a copy of the same duly ratified by the Right\nHonourable the Governor-General in Council, on the receipt of which by the\nRajah, the present Treaty shall be deemed complete and binding on both parties,\nand the copy of it now delivered to the Rajah shall be returned.<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\">Seal and signature of<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\">C.T. METCALFE <o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\">Signature and seal of<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\">RAJAH RUNJEET SING<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\">Company's 'Seal MINTO\n(Sd)<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\">Ratified by the\nGovernor-General in Council on 30th May, 1809.<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This treaty though\nwould put a limit on extending the Sikh kingdom to the south, already occupied\nby the British, it would in theory allow expansion to the North and West\nwithout any interference from the British. This rough terrain was where all the\nMughal treasures were , including the Kohinoor diamond, originally stolen from\nIndia.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-JtYjzsiizs4/URtAaDUto7I/AAAAAAAAe4Y/iQmC-K7N1BI/s1600/imageskkiio.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"249\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-JtYjzsiizs4/URtAaDUto7I/AAAAAAAAe4Y/iQmC-K7N1BI/s400/imageskkiio.jpg\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The British kept low ,\neven after Ranjit Singh vacuumed all the wealth from the North West areas ,\nincluding the Kohinoor diamond and kept it in a nice pile.&nbsp; They would at the right time murder him by\ninducing a stroke by putting extra crushed pearls in his daily aphrodisiac\ndrink,&nbsp; he got addicted to.&nbsp; &nbsp;</span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Addiction\nwas achieved by adding opium in increasing quantities. &nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The stoke would be achieved by clogging his\nkidneys with crushed pearls. &nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">This potion\nwas prepared daily by the Romanian Jew quack doctor. </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Once Ranjit Singh was out of the way they\nwould drive an irreversible wedge between the Rajputs and the Sikhs by making\nthe gullible Sikhs suspect the loyal Rajput members of Ranjit Singh\u2019s inner\ndarbar and army.</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Sir Lepel Griffin a\nBritish propaganda mouthpiece for Rothschild wrote \u201c<b><span style=\"color: red;\">There are perhaps no\ncharacters in Punjab history more repulsive than Rajputs Dhian Singh and Gulab\nSingh Dogra \u201c. &nbsp;</span></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b><span style=\"color: blue;\">Nothing is further than\nthe truth , as both these loyal men were handpicked by Ranjit Singh himself--\nand Ranjit Singh has the capability to gauge men. &nbsp;</span></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b><span style=\"color: blue;\"><br /></span></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b><span style=\"color: blue;\">A distraught Prime Minister Dhian Singh nearly jumped into the funeral pyre of Ranjit Singh, and he was held back by force. &nbsp; Gulab Singh's own son Udam Singh was killed along with Naunihal Singh while returning from the funeral of his father Maharaja Kharak Singh. &nbsp;&nbsp;</span></b></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b><span style=\"color: blue;\"><br /></span></b></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b><span style=\"color: blue;\">Dhian Singh , the blood brother of Gulab Singh , too was badly injured . &nbsp;Naunihal was a great leader at a young age, and he had the potential to be even greater than Ranjit Singh.</span></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b><span style=\"color: blue;\"><br /></span></b></span>\n<span style=\"color: red; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Below Dhian Singh</span><br />\n<span style=\"color: red; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b><span style=\"color: blue;\">It was the Rothschild's British agents who collapsed the stone archway over the passing elephant. They did this to drive a wedge between Rajputs and Sikhs.&nbsp;</span></b></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b><span style=\"color: blue;\"><br /></span></b></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: cyan; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\">In Sikh history Dhian\nSingh is Ram, &nbsp;Gulab Singh is Lakshman\nand Tej singh is Ravan. &nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: cyan; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">It passed through many\nhands over the years.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Nadir Shah was\nassassinated and the Kohinoor diamond fell into the hands of Ahmad Shah Abdali,\none of his ablest generals, who later became the King of Afghanistan.&nbsp; After his death in 1772, the Koh-i-noor diamond\npassed into the hands of his successors. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In the battle for\nsuccession that followed, the Koh-i-noor ended in possession of one of his sons\nShah Shuja Mirza. In the changing fortunes of war, Shuja Mirza was defeated and\nmade prisoner by the allies of his brother, Mahmud Shah.&nbsp;&nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-Fm-4pi1NnOk/URtAg7JsFuI/AAAAAAAAe4g/GVNBbZJvdmg/s1600/imagesnjjik.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"309\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-Fm-4pi1NnOk/URtAg7JsFuI/AAAAAAAAe4g/GVNBbZJvdmg/s400/imagesnjjik.jpg\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">However, before being captured, he managed to\nsend his family to Punjab to seek refuge with Maharaja Ranjit Singh .&nbsp; Wafa Begum, Shuja Mirza\u2019s wife, carried the\nKoh-i-noor diamond with her to Lahore. Wafa Begum became greatly distressed\nwhen she heard the dreadful news of her husband.
