font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Baku temple is\nabout 18 feet square using the principle of Vaastu.&nbsp; In the center is a Agnihotra havanam or\nhomam&nbsp; pit about 3 feet deep and about 4\nfeet square. . &nbsp;The fire burnt continuously\ndue to the natural gas emitting from the bottom of the pit. &nbsp;In a Parsee Atash Kadeh, for the central fire,\na high platform like a throne is erected, NOT a sunken inverted pyramid pit.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://2.bp.blogspot.com/-hi2LIQeHBo0/URNso5ss5sI/AAAAAAAAejg/79AYpb3HRxA/s1600/Yet+Another+Inscription.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"265\" src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-hi2LIQeHBo0/URNso5ss5sI/AAAAAAAAejg/79AYpb3HRxA/s400/Yet+Another+Inscription.jpg\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">At the entrance of the temple\n, there is a foundation stone with inscription in Dev Nagrik script, which in\nthe beginning invokes Shiva\u2019s son Lord Ganesha. . &nbsp;This inscription contains nine lines . The\nfirst row has a bell of the shape found in a Hindu temple.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Then a sun, then a homam\nfire , then a Shiva\u2019s trishul ( trident ) , and a Swastika Vedic symbol. &nbsp;In the inscription, you can see \u201cSHREE\nGANESHAAYANUM\u201d in the first line, the Vikramaajeet Hindu calendar year\n(\u201cVikramaajeet Saake\u201d) in the second line and \u201cShree Jwaalaajee\u201d (the fire\nball) in the third line.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Around the temple there\nis a large square with 25 rooms. &nbsp;They\nare closed from outside , so it appears as a compound wall . &nbsp;Every cell has a door but no windows. &nbsp;&nbsp;In one\nof them is a wall painting of Hindu God, Lord Ganesha exists . &nbsp;Some walls have pictures of banyan trees (\nfound in Hindu temples ) and Shiva\u2019s trident. &nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">One of these cells is more than &nbsp;35 feet long like a common dormitory. &nbsp;Some cells have a dome like structure at the\ntop. Two cells were used to tie up the horses of the visitors. &nbsp;In 20 cells there are Sanskrit inscriptions in\nDevnagiri script.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://3.bp.blogspot.com/-oDdl6ldooeA/URNrz-J3AlI/AAAAAAAAejI/0obdqtvZYQ8/s1600/Tableaux-2.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"261\" src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-oDdl6ldooeA/URNrz-J3AlI/AAAAAAAAejI/0obdqtvZYQ8/s400/Tableaux-2.jpg\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Near the temple is the &nbsp;Vourukash sea ( Caspian sea ). Caspain sea is\noriginally Kashyapa sea.&nbsp; The caviar fish\ncalled \u201cKur Maachee\u201d or Sevruga sturgeon caviar fish . &nbsp;&nbsp;Machee\nis fish in Sanskrit and Hindi. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In the Lenin Museum in\nMoscow, the idols removed from baku temple is exhibited.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Some statues show\nHindu priests in dhoti sitting cross legged doing a Agnihotra fire homam. &nbsp;Some are shown &nbsp;singing kirtans with Hindu musical\ninstruments. &nbsp;They have red dots (Tilaks)\non their foreheads, which nobody else puts . Some are shown weaving a rug. &nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-uhK8379v3F4/URNsvRieqCI/AAAAAAAAejo/aF3Hes8ovGA/s1600/Another+Inscription.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"211\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-uhK8379v3F4/URNsvRieqCI/AAAAAAAAejo/aF3Hes8ovGA/s320/Another+Inscription.jpg\" width=\"320\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">It has an explanatory tablet in Russian in\nwhich they are clearly identified as Hindus. The English translation reproduced\nverbatim is as follows:-<i> \u201cNear the town Baku in the villages of Souratshaanaa\nand Emidjan where the fire (naphtha) comes from the earth lived the Hindoos,\nwho came from India. They were Brahmans. They made a temple and adored the fire\nmany years. They lived there, but now they are not at Baku. It is said then\nyears before they lived in little rooms and worked for money. They built their\ncells. They are not the Parsees - the Guebers who adored Zarathushtra\u201d. </i><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><br /></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-NuguUsJMHhk/URNr8aVaMYI/AAAAAAAAejQ/FXf1o9Xvyhk/s1600/imagesGHKL.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"267\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-NuguUsJMHhk/URNr8aVaMYI/AAAAAAAAejQ/FXf1o9Xvyhk/s400/imagesGHKL.jpg\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The custodian Russian\nlady has the catalog: \u201cThe Description of the Collections in the Ethnographical\nMuseums\u201d<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">So sorry, &nbsp;my dear Parsees, tough luck. &nbsp;Don\u2019t try to grab a chunk of history which is\nnot yours. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">There are twenty\ninscriptions embedded in the the stone walls of the temple complex. &nbsp;Eighteen are in the Nagari Devnagri script,\none is in Punjabi using the Gurumukhi script ( Guru Nanak visited Baku temple before\nhe went to Mecca ) &nbsp;and one is a\nbilingual inscription in Sanskrit and Persian.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">This bilingual inscription is\ndedicated to Lord Ganesh, Jwalaji and fire, and is dated Samvat 1802 (1745-46\nCE). </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Punjabi language inscription is\na quotation from the Adi Granth. The other inscriptions include an invocation\nto Lord Shiva.</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://2.bp.blogspot.com/-3Fv6BIuiX-I/URNq6lYVcfI/AAAAAAAAeio/_EP8KUGjl9E/s1600/BakuAzerbaijan4.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"265\" src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-3Fv6BIuiX-I/URNq6lYVcfI/AAAAAAAAeio/_EP8KUGjl9E/s400/BakuAzerbaijan4.jpg\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Heavy exploitation of\nthe natural gas reserves in the area during Soviet rule resulted in the eternal\nflame getting extinguished &nbsp;in 1969. &nbsp;Tourists stopped coming. Today, the museum\u2019s\nfire is fed by mains gas piped in from Baku. &nbsp;This is one of the most holy pilgrimage places\nfor Hindus, being a Shaktipeedam. Islam rule and then later Communist atheist\nrule killed this age old pilgrimage.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">You must know that Baku and Samarkand were\nold trading areas , where Indian Ayurvedic medicines sole like hot cakes. Also\nin great demand was Indian Teak wood and carpenters from Kerala and Gujarat.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-MHMTx8fipV4/URNrei-B1oI/AAAAAAAAejA/jG2k5TELmsU/s1600/Inscription+above+Main+Entrance.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"640\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-MHMTx8fipV4/URNrei-B1oI/AAAAAAAAejA/jG2k5TELmsU/s640/Inscription+above+Main+Entrance.jpg\" width=\"424\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Jonas Hanway commenting\nin his,&nbsp; An Historical Account of the\nBritish Trade Over the Caspian Sea, 1753 AD states&nbsp; \"&nbsp;\nThere is a little temple, in which the Indians worship: near the altar\nabout 3 feet high is a large hollow cane, from the end of which iffues a blue\nflame... . These Indians affirm, that this flame has continued ever since the\nflood, and they believe it will last to the end of the world. ...\u201d <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Of course Jonas can\nnever ever imagine anything older than Noah\u2019s ark of 2500 BC , as per the old\ntestament of Bible..<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">According to Dr. Sir\nErvad Jivanji Jamshedji Modi (1854-1933), a prominent Zoroastrian Indian\npriest, scholar and Parsi community leader, the fire temple of Baku is a Hindu\ntemple . &nbsp;He is 100% sure about this\nafter examining the temple .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">He wrote more than 70\nbooks, produced over 120 scholarly papers on Zoroastrian history, traveled and\nresearched into Zoroastrian affairs extensively and was instrumental in\norganizing the Parsi community in India. During his lifetime he had been called\n\"the greatest living authority on the ancient history and customs of the\nParsis. &nbsp;Over 45 years from 1888-1933 he\ngave 350 public lectures. &nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Jivanji\ntraveled extensively right into his senior years in the service of his\nanthropological researches. When awarding him the honorary LL.D. the Governor\nof Bombay and Chancellor of the University of Bombay, Sir Ernest Hotson\nreferred to Jivanji as his own particular friend and \u201c.. world famous as a\nscholar of Sanskrit, Persian and Avesta ...unquestionably the greatest living\nauthority on the ancient history and customs of the Parsis...(with) ..so many\nmarks of recognition ..and honour\u201d . <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-wUZ10W7LpkE/URNqyC8oJEI/AAAAAAAAeig/WRRi1R979jw/s1600/clip_image002_0002.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"400\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-wUZ10W7LpkE/URNqyC8oJEI/AAAAAAAAeig/WRRi1R979jw/s400/clip_image002_0002.jpg\" width=\"337\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Is Modi\u2019s statement\navailable on the internet not good enough for the skeptic Parsis?<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Every single &nbsp;Europeans who visited this area in the 17th\nand 18th centuries mention the \u201cbrahmins,\u201d the \u201cIndian ascetics,\u201d or the\nworship of the Hindu fire god, Agni, they observed at Atashgah. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">By the way punch into\nGoogle search <b><span style=\"color: red;\">STONEHENGE OF ARKAIM RUSSIA AJIT VADAKAYIL</span></b>, and get a bit\nshocked.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-o5Vm4uG46Uk/URNqrkKLP0I/AAAAAAAAeiY/AHnym70OG5w/s1600/imagesCA4PKNCY.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"257\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-o5Vm4uG46Uk/URNqrkKLP0I/AAAAAAAAeiY/AHnym70OG5w/s400/imagesCA4PKNCY.jpg\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In his book My Travels\nOutside Bombay Iran, Azerbaijan, Baku (1926) &nbsp;(translated from Gujarati by Soli Dastur)\nnotes: \"the original trade routes and customs changed and the visits of\nthe Hindu traders diminished. &nbsp;And from\nthe original group of the Brahmins, some passed away and a few that were left\nwent back to their original home land.\" &nbsp;By the time of Modi's visit in\n1925, the Surakhani atash gah had been abandoned.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Now let me digress\u2014<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">My readers will wonder \u2013what\nis all this tongue of Sati and heart of Sati ?<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">All they know is Sati\nwas a bad Hindu custom where the poor Hindu widow was thrown into the funeral\npyre of her husband.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Nothing is further from\nthe truth. &nbsp;This was false propaganda by\nthe British using a stooge by the name of Raja Ram Mohan Roy.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Women are NEVER allowed\nto go to the cremation yard , as per timeless Hindu custom.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Yes, in Rajastan after\nthe Muslims invaded, &nbsp;there was this practice\nof Jauhar of Rajput women. &nbsp;In front of\ntheir husbands the women and children jumped into the fire on their own accord ,\nwhen the writing was clear on the wall, that the battle would be lost. &nbsp;This forced the brave Rajputs warriros to fight\nto the last man , and NOT run away in battle.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Consuming poison was no\nuse as the Muslim invaders raped dead women and then buried them . The pretty ones were taken as sex slaves.&nbsp;&nbsp;Jumping into the fire primarily fused their\nvaginas and of course -- to&nbsp; a Hindu\ncremation means liberation &nbsp;of the soul.&nbsp;&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">However--</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">When Maharaja Ranjit\nSingh died in 1839, after a reign of nearly forty years, leaving seven sons by\ndifferent queens. &nbsp;He was cremated, his\nceremony was performed by both Sikh and Hindu priests. &nbsp;His Hindu wife Maharani Mahtab Devi Sahiba, the\nEmpress of Punjab, the Princess of Kangra, daughter of Maharaja Sansar Chand,\ncommitted Sati with Ranjit's body as Ranjit's head lay in her lap; some of the\nother wives also joined her and committed Sati. They were NOT forced to do Sati\n( self immolate ). And Sati is NOT a Sikh custom.</span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-dwTwQchth0g/URStup0nDhI/AAAAAAAAer8/Wvd70FCMtj8/s1600/vhy.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-dwTwQchth0g/URStup0nDhI/AAAAAAAAer8/Wvd70FCMtj8/s1600/vhy.jpg\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Probably my next post will be about this great king.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\nNow let me narrate the lore--</div>\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Legend goes that Sati\nwas born when Gods concentrated their energy at a point on the ground to create\na girl powerful enough to destroy even the fiercest of demons. The Goddess,\ntook human birth at the bidding of the god Brahma. Sati was born as a daughter\nof Daksha Prajapati and his wife Prasuti. &nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Daksha was a son of Brahma and a\ngreat king and magnate in his own right. The girl was named Gauri, \"the\nturmeric-hued one,\". As the daughter of Daksha, she is also known as\nDakshayani. She is also called Sat\u012b By this logic, Sati is grand-daughter of\nBrahma by Daksha, but is also great grand-daughter of Brahma because Prasuti is\ndaughter of Manu (Manu is son of Brahma).<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In bidding the Goddess\nto take human birth, Brahma's design was that she should please Shiva with\nhumble devotions and wed him. It was natural that Gauri ( Sati ) , even as a child,\nadored the tales and legends associated with Shiva and grew up an ardent\ndevotee. As Sati grew to womanhood, the idea of marrying anyone else, as\nintended by her father, became anathema to her.</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Every proposal from valiant and\nrich kings made her crave evermore the ascetic of Kailasa, the God of Gods, who\nbestowed all on this world and himself foreswore all. To win the regard of the\nascetic Shiva, the daughter of king Daksha forsook the luxuries of her father's\npalace and retired to a forest, there to devote herself to austerities and the\nworship of Shiva.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">So rigorous were her penances that she gradually renounced\nfood itself, at one stage subsisting on one bilva leaf a day, and then giving\nup even that nourishment; this particular abstinence earned her the sobriquet\nAparn\u0101. Her prayers finally bore fruit when, after testing her resolve, Shiva\nfinally acceded to her wishes and consented to make her his bride.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; line-height: 150%; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-84sggR_c988/URPufBf40GI/AAAAAAAAeoA/9Du5TClJRfY/s1600/hhu7y6t.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"260\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-84sggR_c988/URPufBf40GI/AAAAAAAAeoA/9Du5TClJRfY/s320/hhu7y6t.jpg\" width=\"320\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">An ecstatic Sati returned to her father's home to await her bridegroom, but found her father\nless than elated by the turn of events. The wedding was however held in due\ncourse, and Sati made her home with Shiva in Kailasa. &nbsp; Daksha, depicted in\nlegend as an arrogant king, did not get on with his renunciative son-in-law and\nbasically cut his daughter away from her natal family.</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">To get even , Daksha Prajapati\nDaksha, the father of Sati once organized a grand yajna to which all the gods\nwere invited, with the exception of Sati and Shiva. &nbsp;Wanting to visit her parents, relatives and\nchildhood friends, Sati sought to rationalize this omission. She reasoned\nwithin herself that her parents had neglected to make a formal invitation to\nthem only because, as family, such formality was unnecessary; certainly, she\nneeded no invitation to visit her own mother and would go anyway.&nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://3.bp.blogspot.com/-fF8XtuqfeTc/URPyTT5D6pI/AAAAAAAAepU/l1JBw_bLSK8/s1600/downloadhkp%5B't.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"285\" src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-fF8XtuqfeTc/URPyTT5D6pI/AAAAAAAAepU/l1JBw_bLSK8/s400/downloadhkp%5B't.jpg\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Sati pestered\nShiva to go to Yajna. Shiva maintained that they should not go uninvited. &nbsp;Shiva sought to dissuade her, but she was\nresolved upon going; he then provided her with an escort of his ganas and bid\nher provoke no incident.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Sati was received\ncoldly by her father. They were soon in the midst of a heated argument about\nthe virtues (and alleged lack thereof) of Shiva. Every passing moment made it\nclearer to Sati that her father was entirely incapable of appreciating the\nmany excellent qualities of her husband.&nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; line-height: 150%; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://4.bp.blogspot.com/-ZoBGIjWw6Uk/URPuXEi-iDI/AAAAAAAAen4/IWSNHxfGNZs/s1600/imagesbju76f.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"400\" src=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-ZoBGIjWw6Uk/URPuXEi-iDI/AAAAAAAAen4/IWSNHxfGNZs/s400/imagesbju76f.jpg\" width=\"327\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The realization then came to Sati that this abuse was being heaped on Shiva only because he had wed her; she was\nthe cause of this dishonour to her husband. Sati noticed that no seat (assan)\nhad been earmarked for her husband Shiva, even if he had gone, which meant a deliberate\nattempt to humiliate Shiva.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">She was consumed by\nrage against her father and loathing for his mentality. Calling up a prayer\nthat she may, in a future birth, be born the daughter of a father whom she\ncould respect, Sati plunged herself into the havankund of Yajna. &nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><b><span style=\"color: blue;\">The exact spot where\nthe yagya or homam took place , in which Sita self immolated is where the\namazing and powerful Kottiyoor temple is situated in Kerala . &nbsp; &nbsp;This spot is THE oldest spot of Shiva-Sati worship in India.</span></b></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><b><span style=\"color: blue;\"><br /></span></b></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-NyfCRGatbpA/Uaq2YVG7jII/AAAAAAAAi4o/oQxelqsz9Wc/s1600/temple4.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-NyfCRGatbpA/Uaq2YVG7jII/AAAAAAAAi4o/oQxelqsz9Wc/s1600/temple4.jpg\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><b><span style=\"color: blue;\"><br /></span></b></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><b><span style=\"color: blue;\">After the yagna got over Lord Shiva&nbsp; took the form of Swayambhu linga&nbsp;&nbsp; and stayed next to where Sati immolated\nherself.&nbsp; &nbsp;Since all the gods and goddesses were present\nin the place this place got to be known as Koodiyur ( renamed by British as Kottiyoor\n).<o:p></o:p></span></b></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><b><span style=\"color: blue;\"><br /></span></b></i></span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; line-height: 150%; text-align: center;\">\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-xrpVGtRyrWs/Uaq2QcI3MNI/AAAAAAAAi4g/Nm140ozkBPg/s1600/images.jpgGTGI.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"299\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-xrpVGtRyrWs/Uaq2QcI3MNI/AAAAAAAAi4g/Nm140ozkBPg/s400/images.jpgGTGI.jpg\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><b><span style=\"color: blue;\"><br /></span></b></i></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Shiva sensed this catastrophe, and his rage\nwas incomparable&nbsp; &nbsp;Shiva rushed to the spot and found Sati half\nburnt and dead.</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">He loved Sati more than\nany and would never love after her. So, he created Virabhadra and Bhadrakali,\nsome call as [Manbhadra], two ferocious creatures who wreaked havoc and mayhem\non the scene of the horrific incident. Nearly all those present were\nindiscriminately felled overnight. Daksha himself was decapitated.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; line-height: 150%; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-D9n5FCdpaIY/URPvAl1ignI/AAAAAAAAeoo/zzGJn2poOYQ/s1600/imagesbjko;.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-D9n5FCdpaIY/URPvAl1ignI/AAAAAAAAeoo/zzGJn2poOYQ/s1600/imagesbjko;.jpg\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The gruesome deed done , Shiva performed the fearsome and awe-inspiring\nTandava dance .&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; line-height: 150%; text-align: center;\">\n<object class=\"BLOGGER-youtube-video\" classid=\"clsid:D27CDB6E-AE6D-11cf-96B8-444553540000\" codebase=\"http://download.macromedia.com/pub/shockwave/cabs/flash/swflash.cab#version=6,0,40,0\" data-thumbnail-src=\"http://2.gvt0.com/vi/8x3NDMnCtuY/0.jpg\" height=\"266\" width=\"320\"><param name=\"movie\" value=\"http://www.youtube.com/v/8x3NDMnCtuY&fs=1&source=uds\" /><param name=\"bgcolor\" value=\"#FFFFFF\" /><param name=\"allowFullScreen\" value=\"true\" /><embed width=\"320\" height=\"266\"  src=\"http://www.youtube.com/v/8x3NDMnCtuY&fs=1&source=uds\" type=\"application/x-shockwave-flash\" allowfullscreen=\"true\"></embed></object></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Shiva then placed his wife Gauri's ( Sati ) body on his shoulder and ran about the\nworld, crazed with grief.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; line-height: 150%; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://4.bp.blogspot.com/-g6Hi8fJ7GvA/URPvXiREunI/AAAAAAAAeo4/oah35RgPD-0/s1600/imagescvnm,..jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"400\" src=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-g6Hi8fJ7GvA/URPvXiREunI/AAAAAAAAeo4/oah35RgPD-0/s400/imagescvnm,..jpg\" width=\"310\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In order to protect the\nuniverse from the wrath of Shiva, Lord Vishnu dismembered the body of Sati used\nhis Sudarshana Chakra &nbsp;. The dismembered\nparts of her body fell at 54 different places in India, Turkey, Azaerbaijan and\nSri lanka.&nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://2.bp.blogspot.com/-CWrdKogAqcU/URRhqPRxVlI/AAAAAAAAers/6zEJyg-I8xE/s1600/imagesgnm.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"300\" src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-CWrdKogAqcU/URRhqPRxVlI/AAAAAAAAers/6zEJyg-I8xE/s400/imagesgnm.jpg\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">These places came to be known as Shaktipeeths or centers of power. Her\ntongue fell at the spot where the Jwalamukhi temple near Kangra is now\nsituated. These places have become major centers of pilgrimage as they are held\nby the Goddess-oriented Shakta sect to be particularly holy.</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">After the night of\nhorror, Shiva, the all-forgiving, restored all those who were slain to life and\ngranted them his blessings. Even the abusive and culpable Daksha was restored\nboth his life and his kingship.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; line-height: 150%; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-0bkKb2iMo_c/URPu6KQcZKI/AAAAAAAAeog/Vvb8_NKzMKE/s1600/downloadhhy.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"320\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-0bkKb2iMo_c/URPu6KQcZKI/AAAAAAAAeog/Vvb8_NKzMKE/s320/downloadhhy.jpg\" width=\"226\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">His decapitated head was substituted for that\nof a goat. Having learned his lesson, Daksha spent his remaining years as a\ndevotee of Shiva.</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Sat\u012b, &nbsp;reincarnated as &nbsp;Parvati , Shiva\u2019s second wife and is the\nmother of Lord Ganesha &nbsp;and Lord Skanda\n(Kartikeya).<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; line-height: 150%; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://2.bp.blogspot.com/-1Qpjq6WHQBg/URPurHLgzCI/AAAAAAAAeoQ/goGThiWWifE/s1600/ShivaAcceptParvati_22843.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"278\" src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-1Qpjq6WHQBg/URPurHLgzCI/AAAAAAAAeoQ/goGThiWWifE/s320/ShivaAcceptParvati_22843.jpg\" width=\"320\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">She is also known by\n108 names from the Durga Saptashati. Her different mood brings different forms\nor incarnation. Parvati is considered to be Goddess Kali herself in her most ferocious\nform. As Durga she is black in color and rides on lion, she is known as the\noriginal slayer of Demon Mahishasura.</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<object class=\"BLOGGER-youtube-video\" classid=\"clsid:D27CDB6E-AE6D-11cf-96B8-444553540000\" codebase=\"http://download.macromedia.com/pub/shockwave/cabs/flash/swflash.cab#version=6,0,40,0\" data-thumbnail-src=\"http://3.gvt0.com/vi/tSwfgAmQsy8/0.jpg\" height=\"266\" width=\"320\"><param name=\"movie\" value=\"http://www.youtube.com/v/tSwfgAmQsy8&fs=1&source=uds\" /><param name=\"bgcolor\" value=\"#FFFFFF\" /><param name=\"allowFullScreen\" value=\"true\" /><embed width=\"320\" height=\"266\"  src=\"http://www.youtube.com/v/tSwfgAmQsy8&fs=1&source=uds\" type=\"application/x-shockwave-flash\" allowfullscreen=\"true\"></embed></object></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">54 Shakti Peethas of\nSati, proves that all Goddesses are expansions of the Goddess Parvati.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In the Sri yantra divine\ngeometry , revealed in 8000 BC to the Maharishi seers , the 3 lines intersect\nat 54 points ( number of sanskrit alphabets ) .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">With Shiva and Shakti\nqualities &nbsp;( Yin Yang ) making the magic\nnumber 108, or the number of beads in a Rudraksha mala.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Jwalamukhi pertains to\nthe 9 forms of Durga ( Sati), hence 9 eternal flames in the fire temple. &nbsp;The nine flames have been named after\ngoddesses - Mahakali, Unpurna, Chandi, Hinglaj, Bindhya Basni, Maha Lakshmi,\nSaraswati, Ambika and Anji Devi, continuously burning without adding any fuel, or human assistance.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; line-height: 150%; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://3.bp.blogspot.com/-HAduGKjQgwo/URPttSpFNUI/AAAAAAAAeno/3C58Jvyx1Jg/s1600/imagesCAMWQTF4.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"320\" src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-HAduGKjQgwo/URPttSpFNUI/AAAAAAAAeno/3C58Jvyx1Jg/s320/imagesCAMWQTF4.jpg\" width=\"320\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Sri Yantra in 3D consists of 9 spiral energy\nvortices , 5 pointing downwards and 4 pointing upwards \u2013 the &nbsp;mystical holographic construct of the Cosmos, revealed to seers in 8000 BC.</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; line-height: 150%; text-align: center;\">\n<object class=\"BLOGGER-youtube-video\" classid=\"clsid:D27CDB6E-AE6D-11cf-96B8-444553540000\" codebase=\"http://download.macromedia.com/pub/shockwave/cabs/flash/swflash.cab#version=6,0,40,0\" data-thumbnail-src=\"http://2.gvt0.com/vi/unB-Paz-5No/0.jpg\" height=\"266\" width=\"320\"><param name=\"movie\" value=\"http://www.youtube.com/v/unB-Paz-5No&fs=1&source=uds\" /><param name=\"bgcolor\" value=\"#FFFFFF\" /><param name=\"allowFullScreen\" value=\"true\" /><embed width=\"320\" height=\"266\"  src=\"http://www.youtube.com/v/unB-Paz-5No&fs=1&source=uds\" type=\"application/x-shockwave-flash\" allowfullscreen=\"true\"></embed></object></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Now about the fire\ntemple at Kangra valley Himachal Pradesh, India. . It is the most renowned\ntemple of Goddess Durga in India.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; line-height: 150%; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://4.bp.blogspot.com/-lxooTyS4ezA/URPt9uE4MwI/AAAAAAAAenw/ye1Z_z4Z4ac/s1600/550222_3610999949982_1123247603_3346468_1935925939_n.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"320\" src=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-lxooTyS4ezA/URPt9uE4MwI/AAAAAAAAenw/ye1Z_z4Z4ac/s320/550222_3610999949982_1123247603_3346468_1935925939_n.jpg\" width=\"240\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A cowherd found that\none of his cows was always without milk. He followed the cow to find out the\ncause. He saw a girl come out of the forest, drink the cows milk, and then\ndisappear in a flash of light. The cowherd went to the king and told him the\nstory. The king was aware of the legend that Sati's tongue had fallen in this\narea. The king tried, without success, to find that sacred spot.&nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Again, some\nyears later, the cowherd went to the king to report that he had seen a flame\nburning in the mountains. The king found the spot and had darshan (vision) of\nthe holy flame. He built a temple there and arranged for priests to enguage in\nregular worship. It is believed that the Pandavas came later in 4000 BC, and\nrenovated the temple.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Aarti is performed five\ntimes in the day, havan is performed once daily and portions of Durga Saptasati\nare recited.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; line-height: 150%; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-HWnXWubA6DM/URPuxvG_JfI/AAAAAAAAeoY/E4oYRRxv3K0/s1600/imagesVN,,L.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"299\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-HWnXWubA6DM/URPuxvG_JfI/AAAAAAAAeoY/E4oYRRxv3K0/s400/imagesVN,,L.jpg\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The temple was looted\nand destroyed by Mahmud of Ghazni in 1009.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Mughal Emperor\nAkbar, learning about the legends of Jwalamukhi tried to douse the flames with\na stream of water. However, the great power of the Goddess, still kept the\nflames burning. Realizing the power of Jwala Devi, Akbar came with his army to\nthis temple. He brought a Gold umbrella (Chatra) for the Goddess, but on\noffering, the umbrella turned into an unknown metal suggesting that the Goddess\ndid not accept his offering.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://4.bp.blogspot.com/-vg8DYzoWPAc/URPygggVe4I/AAAAAAAAepc/7M1bytm0PTM/s1600/jwalamukhi1.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"320\" src=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-vg8DYzoWPAc/URPygggVe4I/AAAAAAAAepc/7M1bytm0PTM/s320/jwalamukhi1.jpg\" width=\"241\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"color: red; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><b>You can see that the archway style of this ancient Indian temple is the same as in the temple at Baku.</b></i></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Maharaja Ranjit Singh\npaid a visit to the temple in 1815 and the dome of the temple was gold-plated\nby him.&nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\"><b>In 1802 Ranjit Singh &nbsp;learnt of the drop dead gorgeous &nbsp;daughters of the Raja of Kangra,&nbsp; Sansar Chand Katoch&nbsp; . &nbsp;&nbsp;At that time he was just 22 years old. &nbsp;The father would NOT give his daughter to a\nshot man with one eye and face pock marked with small pix\u2014to be frank Maharaja Ranjit\nSingh, though a great king &nbsp;was\nrepulsively ugly and could neither read or write. &nbsp;</b></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\"><b><br /></b></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\"><b>The army of Maharaja Ranjit Singh advanced on\nKangra and in a series of battles the Raja was defeated.&nbsp; &nbsp;He\ntook refuge in Kangra Fort, but Ranjit Singh assaulted the fort through one of\nthe gates which even now carries his name as \u201cRanjit Singh Gate\u201d. Raja Sansar\nChand ultimately agreed to give his daughters in marriage , sued for peace and\nwas given his territory back.&nbsp;</b></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\"><b><br /></b></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://4.bp.blogspot.com/-YKuDIalrzgM/UReV0ZmIYYI/AAAAAAAAetM/0lTa_WSzmC0/s1600/downloaddfghj.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"400\" src=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-YKuDIalrzgM/UReV0ZmIYYI/AAAAAAAAetM/0lTa_WSzmC0/s400/downloaddfghj.jpg\" width=\"306\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\"><b><br /></b></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\"><b>Ranjit Singh married both the princesses at this\nfire temple of Jwalalmukhi, and had both servicing him on the wedding night, together ( as per his French general ) . &nbsp;&nbsp;One of the Rajput sisters Maharani Mahtab Devi Sahiba (Guddan Raj Banso)&nbsp; performed sati at the death of the Maharaja, she\nsat calmly with his head in her lap , while the funeral fire was lit . &nbsp;The other sister\nwas prevented as she was supposed to be pregnant...</b></span></i><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Just a few feet above the Jwalamukhi temple there is a six-feet deep\npit with a circumference of about three-feet. At the bottom of this pit there is\nanother small pit about one and a half feet deep with hot water bubbling all\nthe time.</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The legend has that\nthere was a time the Mount Himalaya and its surroundings were under the\nabstract control of the demons.&nbsp; They\nharassed the life of deities and sages, they all appealed to Lord Vishnu.&nbsp;&nbsp; As instructed by Lord Vishnu, all the\nspiritual energies of the deities turned into a flame and as desired by the\ndeities and Sages Goddess . &nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; line-height: 150%; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://3.bp.blogspot.com/-7Q59ODZgCJ4/URPuj7WryII/AAAAAAAAeoI/4HGMxFdh7-0/s1600/imagestuio;tr4rf.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"320\" src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-7Q59ODZgCJ4/URPuj7WryII/AAAAAAAAeoI/4HGMxFdh7-0/s320/imagestuio;tr4rf.jpg\" width=\"257\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Sati was rose\nfrom the flame and she was brought up by Daksha Prajapath. &nbsp;Sati was born in a Agnihotra fire and died in the\nsame fire.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Kandahar city in\nAfghanistan is the current mispronunciation of the Sanskrit term \u201cGandhar\u201d\nwhich was the capital of a flourishing ancient Hindu kingdom. &nbsp;Gandhari, wife of King Dhritarastra &nbsp;was born in 4100 BC here.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://2.bp.blogspot.com/-zPVrHjXbLxc/URRhi8PI0NI/AAAAAAAAerk/ZBDez-nTzCs/s1600/IsGoddessDurgathesupremeuniversalmother3.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"400\" src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-zPVrHjXbLxc/URRhi8PI0NI/AAAAAAAAerk/ZBDez-nTzCs/s400/IsGoddessDurgathesupremeuniversalmother3.png\" width=\"342\" /></a></div>\n<br /></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">After their defeat in\nthe Mahabharata war, many of the Kaurva descendants settled in the Kandhar\nregion which was their maternal home.&nbsp;\nFrom there they gradually moved to what are currently known as Iraq and\nSaudi Arabia.&nbsp; In ancient times, Arab\nhorses were well-known for their fine breed (Arva in Sanskrit signifies a\nhorse).&nbsp; Being warriors, Kaurvas highly\nappreciated the well-bred horses of the region. That is why they named the\nregion as Arvasthan (Land of Horses)\u2014&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Arabia ,now rings a bell, right?.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</div>\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">There is a Shiva temple\nin Tashkent, the capital of Uzbekistan even today. &nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Right from Palestine (\nPalisthan), every STAN like Pakistan, Rajastan, Afghanishan, Uzbekistan, Krgystan,\nTajikistan ete belonged to the old Vikramaditya empire .&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: red; font-size: large;\"><b>Vararuchi\nwas Raja Bhoj\u2019s religious and Vedic knowledge minister in 2800 BC.</b></span><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Vararuchi from whom\nVarahamihira drew inspiration -- the founder of Kerala system of Astrology,\nwhose work Chandra Vakyas, and Kapatayadi system of counting is well\ndocumented. &nbsp;&nbsp;Vararuchi lived 200 years before Varahamihira\n( Mihir Muni 2660 BC ).<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Punch into google\nsearch </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue; font-size: large;\"><b>MIHIRA MUNI , THE GREAT ASTROLOGER CUM ASTRONOMER VADAKAYIL</b></span><span style=\"font-size: small;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<br />\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">There was a large wheel\ndepicted on the wall on which were written many verses . These were all on&nbsp; Vyaakarana&nbsp;\n( grammar ) . The entire&nbsp; Vyaakarana&nbsp; Shastra&nbsp;\nhad been written in verse and charted in the form of a&nbsp; wheel . It is claimed that a mere glance at\nthe giant wheel would make the Vyaakarana clear .&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Since Vyaakarana has the\nstatus of an object of reverence and worship , the wheel of Vyaakarana was\ninstalled in a temple .&nbsp; This ancient Saraswati temple\nat Dhar , now stands as a muslim Mosque made with broken temple stones, built in&nbsp;1405&nbsp; by Dilawar Khan.&nbsp; &nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; , &quot;serif&quot;;\">Vararuchi's </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif;\">&nbsp;KATAPAYADI SYSTEM which he taught in the ancient Bhojsala university which is now a mosque.</span></span></b></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Here is the Vararuchi &nbsp;system from Sanskrit verses .&nbsp;&nbsp;They are not bumpkin shepherd\u2019s verses.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Vararuchi was a Mathematician from Kerala who taught at Bhoj Shala University inside the Saraswati Temple in 2860 BC .&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\">&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\">\u0930\u0938\u0902\u0927\u0930\u0903</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif;\"><i><span style=\"font-size: large;\">Gopibhagya madhuvrata srngisodadhisandhiga|<o:p></o:p></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif;\"><i><span style=\"font-size: large;\">Khalajivitakhatava galahalarasandhara||<o:p></o:p></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Ka\u1e6dapay\u0101di system dictates that:<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\">* As the first digit is 3, the first consonant must be one of ga, \u1e0da, ba, la<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\">* As the second digit is 1, the second consonant must be one of ka, \u1e6da, pa, ya<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\">* For the third digit to be 4, the third consonant must be one of gha, \u1e0dha, bha, va\u2026<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\">So to fit&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif;\"><span style=\"color: red; font-size: large;\"><b>3.14159265358979</b></span></span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif;\"><b><span style=\"color: red; font-size: large;\">3</span></b><span style=\"font-size: small;\">\u2026, the list of consonants in the verse must satisfy the regex<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; In ancient days this water used to be LIVING ganges water.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">The base has a run off\nfor water \u2013 and this water is holy theertham . font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Swami Chinmayananda ,\nthe great Indian spiritual leader , was once asked how he became a swami.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://4.bp.blogspot.com/-0MOACx0tDUA/UQ9UOdRqHQI/AAAAAAAAd3Q/FbCPtdxICGI/s1600/downloadvgg.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em;
