font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">He said \u2013<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">QUOTE &nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Soon after my\nhigh school final exams were over, I embarked on a tour of South India with a\npackage tour railway ticket. &nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">When the\nsteam train passed the Tiruvannamalai Temple most of my fellow travellers in the compartment, bowed\ntowards it with great reverence and talk in the carriage turned to the personage of Ramana Maharshi.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Although at that time in his I was a &nbsp;\"a convinced atheist\", the word\nMaharshi conjured up in my mind &nbsp;ancient\nforest retreats and glowing superhuman divine beings and I became intrigued\nenough to take the next available train to Tiruvannamalai to see the Rishi.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">At the Ashram I\nwas told that the Maharshi was in the hall and anybody was free to walk in and\nsee him. As I entered, I saw on the couch an elderly man, wearing but a\nloincloth, reclining against a round bolster.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">I sat down at the very foot of\nthe couch. The Maharshi suddenly opened his eyes and looked straight into mine:\nI looked into his. A mere look, that was all. I felt that the Maharshi was, in\nthat split moment, looking deep into me \u2013 and I was sure that he saw all my\nshallowness, confusions, faithlessness, imperfections, and fears.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">I cannot explain\nwhat happened in that one split moment. I felt opened, cleaned, healed, and\nemptied! A whirl of confusions: my atheism dropping away, but scepticism\nflooding in to question, wonder, and search. My reason gave me strength and I\nsaid to myself, \u2018It is all mesmerism, my own foolishness.\u2019 Thus assuring\nmyself, I got up and walked away.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">But the boy who left the hall was not the boy\nwho had gone in some ten minutes before. After my college days, my political\nwork, and after my years of stay at Uttarkashi at the feet of my master,\nTapovanam I knew that what I gained on the Ganges banks was that which had been\ngiven to me years before by the saint of Tiruvannamalai on that hot summer day\n\u2013&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">-- by a mere look. (<span style=\"color: blue;\"> <i>Somerset Maugham who wrote the Razor's edge is too DAFT to talk about this</i>&nbsp;, <i>as he would NOT even know what a <b style=\"background-color: yellow;\">changing human aura</b> is</i>&nbsp;&nbsp;</span>)&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">UNQUOTE&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://3.bp.blogspot.com/-O1uxDUopSLM/URBr2OnFAlI/AAAAAAAAeAw/gzmI8tm-0PQ/s1600/vbhjjk.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"400\" src=\"http://3.bp.blogspot.com/-O1uxDUopSLM/URBr2OnFAlI/AAAAAAAAeAw/gzmI8tm-0PQ/s400/vbhjjk.jpg\" width=\"310\" /></a></div>\n<br />\n<i><span style=\"color: red;\">Check out the video below, and you can see that Sigmund Freud would have done well to listen to this.</span></i><br />\n<span style=\"font-size: large;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<object class=\"BLOGGER-youtube-video\" classid=\"clsid:D27CDB6E-AE6D-11cf-96B8-444553540000\" codebase=\"http://download.macromedia.com/pub/shockwave/cabs/flash/swflash.cab#version=6,0,40,0\" data-thumbnail-src=\"http://3.gvt0.com/vi/weXKuURMgMs/0.jpg\" height=\"266\" width=\"320\"><param name=\"movie\" value=\"http://www.youtube.com/v/weXKuURMgMs&fs=1&source=uds\" /><param name=\"bgcolor\" value=\"#FFFFFF\" /><param name=\"allowFullScreen\" value=\"true\" /><embed width=\"320\" height=\"266\"  src=\"http://www.youtube.com/v/weXKuURMgMs&fs=1&source=uds\" type=\"application/x-shockwave-flash\" allowfullscreen=\"true\"></embed></object></div>\n<span style=\"font-size: large;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Arunachala refers to\nthe holy hill at Thiruvannamalai in Tamil Nadu. &nbsp;The hill is also known by the names Arunagiri,\nAnnamalai Hill or Arunachalam.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">It is one of the five\nmain shaivite holy places in South India. &nbsp;The Arunachaleswara temple, a temple of Lord\nShiva is located at the base of the hill. &nbsp;Every year in the Tamil month of Karthigai\n(October\u2013November), the Karthigai Deepam (Light) is lit atop the hill.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">It is also an important\nplace for devotees of Sri Ramana Maharshi, with Sri Ramana Ashram situated at\nits foothills.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Every year, on the\ntenth day of the celebration of Karthikai, devotees take embers in pots from\nthe sacred fire lit in the Arunachaleswara temple and carry them to the top of\nArunachala, along with cloth wicks. An enormous cauldron is placed on the\nhighest of Arunachala's five peaks and filled with hundreds of gallons of ghee\nmixed with camphor. &nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">At precisely six\no'clock, as the sun sets and the full moon rises, lights are lit on the top of\nthe Hill, on a flagstaff in the temple, and at Sri Ramanasramam, accompanied by\nchants of Arunachala Siva by the vast crowds.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The fire on top of Arunachala can\nbe seen for miles around. Sri Ramana Maharshi described the meaning of this\nevent in this way: &nbsp;<i>\u201c To turn the\nintellect inwards and have it fixed in the Heart, thereby merging it with the\nindweller of the Heart\u201d</i><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><br /></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<object class=\"BLOGGER-youtube-video\" classid=\"clsid:D27CDB6E-AE6D-11cf-96B8-444553540000\" codebase=\"http://download.macromedia.com/pub/shockwave/cabs/flash/swflash.cab#version=6,0,40,0\" data-thumbnail-src=\"http://1.gvt0.com/vi/y5YFGej04QE/0.jpg\" height=\"266\" width=\"320\"><param name=\"movie\" value=\"http://www.youtube.com/v/y5YFGej04QE&fs=1&source=uds\" /><param name=\"bgcolor\" value=\"#FFFFFF\" /><param name=\"allowFullScreen\" value=\"true\" /><embed width=\"320\" height=\"266\"  src=\"http://www.youtube.com/v/y5YFGej04QE&fs=1&source=uds\" type=\"application/x-shockwave-flash\" allowfullscreen=\"true\"></embed></object></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<span style=\"font-size: large;\"><br />\n</span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-size: large;\"><span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Carl Gustav Jung said\nthis of &nbsp;Ramana Maharshi:-- \u201c Sri Ramana\nis a true son of the Indian earth. He is genuine and, in addition to that,\nsomething quite phenomenal. In India he is the whitest spot in a white space.\nWhat we find in the life and teachings of Sri Ramana is the purest of India;\nwith its breath of world-liberated and liberating humanity, it is a chant of\nmillenniums...\u201d<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-size: large;\">\n</span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-size: large;\"><span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-size: large;\">\n</span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-size: large;\"><span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Here is a piece of\nadvise to Jung.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-size: large;\">\n</span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-size: large;\"><span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-size: large;\">\n</span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-size: large;\"><span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Western psychology has\nnot asked a basic question -- who am I? ( Nan Yar ? like Ramana Maharshi ) --\nbecause that question will destroy the false ego. &nbsp;And to ask that question\nmeans you are entering into the world of meditation, and meditation in other\nwords is a state of no-mind.</span></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-size: large;\">\n<span style=\"font-size: large;\"><br /></span>\n</span><br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<span style=\"font-size: large;\"><object class=\"BLOGGER-youtube-video\" classid=\"clsid:D27CDB6E-AE6D-11cf-96B8-444553540000\" codebase=\"http://download.macromedia.com/pub/shockwave/cabs/flash/swflash.cab#version=6,0,40,0\" data-thumbnail-src=\"http://1.gvt0.com/vi/ASKel3HXDmk/0.jpg\" height=\"266\" width=\"320\"><param name=\"movie\" value=\"http://www.youtube.com/v/ASKel3HXDmk&fs=1&source=uds\" /><param name=\"bgcolor\" value=\"#FFFFFF\" /><param name=\"allowFullScreen\" value=\"true\" /><embed width=\"320\" height=\"266\"  src=\"http://www.youtube.com/v/ASKel3HXDmk&fs=1&source=uds\" type=\"application/x-shockwave-flash\" allowfullscreen=\"true\"></embed></object></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-size: large;\">\n<span style=\"font-size: large;\"></span></span>\n<br />\n<div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n</div>\n<span style=\"font-size: large;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><br /></span></span>\n</span></span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-size: large;\"><span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Ramana Maharshi is\nresponsible for the renaissance of Adi Shankaracharya\u2019s, four millineums old\nAdvaita movement \u2013 at one of the darkest times of humanity, totally hijacked\nand vitriol blinded by big brother ( of the banking cartel cum British East\nIndia Company ),&nbsp; who home grew their own\npsychoanalysts and John Galts . <o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-size: large;\"><span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-size: large;\"><span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">He walked this planet\nwith the brilliant light that was needed to restore the&nbsp; Sanatana Dharma of truth and righteousness.<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-size: large;\"><span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-size: large;\"><span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Ramana Maharshi\u2019s simple\nmethod of self enquiry and self surrender did away with all the confusing\nspiritual practices and bizarre Western theories which have muddled the path to\nenlightenment for hundreds of years.<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-size: large;\"><span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-size: large;\"><span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Psychoanalysts Sigmund\nFreud and Carl Jung , who wrote volumes about ego without a dang clue, must\nknow that only meditation can help them discover something beyond&nbsp; mind. It is impossible to dip out of Vedic\nphilosophy otherwise, the way they did . <o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-size: large;\"><span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-size: large;\"><span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The ego exists between\nthe mind and the body. &nbsp;It is a false\ncreation. The self exists not between body and mind,&nbsp; but beyond mind.&nbsp; And to reach to the self you have to learn\nthe ways how the mind can be silenced, so its constant chattering is not\nthere.&nbsp; Because the real self is absolute\nsilence.<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-size: large;\"><span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-size: large;\"><span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Meditation is a state\nof no-mind. And big brother\u2019s pet psychoanalysts have worked overtime to deny\nany such state as no-mind . &nbsp;They have\ntried to bury the 11000 year long history of the Indian Vedic seers. The whole\nof western psychology is just a bullshit one century old pseudo science, born\nout of big brother\u2019s vested compulsions . &nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-size: large;\"><span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-size: large;\"><span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The greatest\npsychoanalyst in the west is still prone to the same kind of sicknesses as any\nordinary man, to the same schizophrenia. As far as his expertise is concerned\nhe is well- trained, but as far as his humanity is concerned, he is just as\nordinary as anybody else. <o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-size: large;\"><span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-size: large;\"><span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">There is no\ntransformation in him nor can he create one. &nbsp;Has any western psychoanalyst ever\nshown a bit of calm or certainty or authority or bliss , ever ? &nbsp;Other than big\nbrother\u2019s monopolized books and media , whoever prints them or reads them? <o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-size: large;\"><span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-size: large;\"><span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Every psychoanalyst has\nbeen afraid to talk with a Indian mystic. For they will be soon totally exposed.&nbsp;</span></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-size: large;\"><span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">When Carl Gustav Jung came to India he went to see the Taj Mahal, &nbsp;and the sex temples of Khajuraho though\neverybody kept reminding him and asking him, when he will visit Ramana\nMaharshi. <o:p></o:p></span></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-size: large;\"><span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Do you require 3 months\nto see the dang Taj Mahal? </span><span style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: x-large;\"><b>&nbsp;</b></span></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: x-large;\"><b><br /></b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-i0nB9S_-o_g/URByLMoysII/AAAAAAAAeCo/NBXEcL_D6uQ/s1600/cvgyy.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; &nbsp;Unlike Jew Sigmund Freud\nwho had a special rapport with Jewish Big Brother, where he got all ZE masala back\nhome itself..<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<span style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">The western authors\nkept needling him \"You being one of the topmost psychoanalysts in the west, you should not miss this golden opportunity of meeting an eastern mystic who has\ncome to his full flowering.\"</span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-size: large;\"><span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">He was in the state of\nTamil Nadu and , within two hours distance he could have reached Ramana\nMaharshi.&nbsp; For three months he was in\nIndia, but he avoided Ramana Maharshi like the plague .<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-size: large;\"><span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">One western thinker\ngave him egg on his face&nbsp; \u201c The west don\u2019t\nneed to follow Ramana Maharshi, who himself says every time , that you don\u2019t\nhave to follow him or use his methods . &nbsp;The\nreal reason is that all your psychoanalysis and philosophy is weak and fragile and\nyou are afraid to meet this uneducated man who ran away to be a saint at the age\nof 16\u201c<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-size: large;\"><span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<span style=\"font-size: large;\"><a href=\"http://4.bp.blogspot.com/-MrVed-C8xWs/UQ9qNTBwbkI/AAAAAAAAd5I/9KEO2ZYxjw4/s1600/fggh.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"400\" src=\"http://4.bp.blogspot.com/-MrVed-C8xWs/UQ9qNTBwbkI/AAAAAAAAd5I/9KEO2ZYxjw4/s400/fggh.jpg\" width=\"303\" /></a></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-size: large;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-size: large;\"><span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The western\npsychoanalyst is afraid of meeting an eastern sage , because shallow western\nphilosophy , other than what is lifted from the ancient Vedic thought and stitched together in a clumsy manner , is based on\nshifting sands , and has no foundation. &nbsp;</span></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-size: large;\"><span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Or perhaps our man Carl\nJung was trying to convey a superiority complex as an evolved human in a natty three\npiece suit , while Ramana Maharishi just wore a strip of cloth to cover his\nloins? &nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-IS8XDu9jbfg/UQ-iu_eNJnI/AAAAAAAAd9A/iwrt-oViuzU/s1600/ramana_maharshi_monkey_devotee.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"400\" src=\"http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-IS8XDu9jbfg/UQ-iu_eNJnI/AAAAAAAAd9A/iwrt-oViuzU/s400/ramana_maharshi_monkey_devotee.jpg\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Indian civilization put down\ntheir lofty philosophical thoughts in the Vedas and Upanishads as early as 5000\nBC, when the west were doing grunt grunt for language. The Indians had lived\nall its glories that the west thinks it is attaining now 7000 year ago. &nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Look at our literature, &nbsp;sculptures, music, poetry. &nbsp;Could Jung ever think that the ancient Indian people\nwho had such creativity could be looked down upon just like that \u2013just because\nafter 800 years of slavery the entire glory got hijacked, in as much as the\nwhite blonde blue eyed man called himself an Aryan and claimed that he wore our\nVedas?&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-size: large;\"><span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<span style=\"font-size: large;\"><a href=\"http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-LDZS8aRamy4/UQ9qcZNNjRI/AAAAAAAAd5Q/avQfHspNAoY/s1600/imagesrth.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"266\" src=\"http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-LDZS8aRamy4/UQ9qcZNNjRI/AAAAAAAAd5Q/avQfHspNAoY/s320/imagesrth.jpg\" width=\"320\" /></a></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-size: large;\"><span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-size: large;\"><span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">See Sigmund Freud's shallow thought above-- </span><span style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; line-height: 150%;\"><b><span style=\"color: red;\">TEE HEEEE !!</span></b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-size: large;\"><span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></span>\n<span style=\"font-size: large;\"><span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">George Bush also had such PROFOUND thoughts.</span></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-size: large;\"><span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://3.bp.blogspot.com/-04pTG-ltOjA/UQ-k6vFAQLI/AAAAAAAAd-4/BDjNwo4wj6w/s1600/njjjyt.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"http://3.bp.blogspot.com/-04pTG-ltOjA/UQ-k6vFAQLI/AAAAAAAAd-4/BDjNwo4wj6w/s1600/njjjyt.jpg\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-size: large;\"><span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: magenta; font-size: large;\"><b>In 1995, Rice University\nProfessor of Philosophy and Religious Studies , Jeffrey John Kripal's book, &nbsp;Kali\u2019s Child: The Mystical\nand the Erotic in the Life and Teachings of Ramakrishna Paramahamsa was\nreleased, a highly controversial psychoanalytic study of Ramakrishna. &nbsp;</b></span></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: magenta; font-size: large;\"><b><br /></b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://4.bp.blogspot.com/-la8kROIZQVU/URE8tGFogqI/AAAAAAAAeOU/4d9fvDiSwC0/s1600/ddfg.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"400\" src=\"http://4.bp.blogspot.com/-la8kROIZQVU/URE8tGFogqI/AAAAAAAAeOU/4d9fvDiSwC0/s400/ddfg.jpg\" width=\"300\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: magenta; font-size: large;\"><b><br /></b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: magenta; font-size: large;\"><b>It won great acclaim among white Christians and Jews\nand secured the American Academy of Religion's Best First Book in the History\nof Religions Prize in 1996. &nbsp;&nbsp;</b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: magenta; font-size: large;\"><b><br /></b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: magenta; font-size: large;\"><b><span style=\"background-color: yellow;\">Jeffrey portrayed , Swami Vivekananda's guru, Ramakrishna Paramahamsa as a she-male,\ncross dresser, gay and a pedophile </span>. &nbsp;&nbsp;</b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://3.bp.blogspot.com/-6oFJbEvWTXE/URHFnHgNeKI/AAAAAAAAeSc/UKgTVj0T8SA/s1600/hjkl.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"http://3.bp.blogspot.com/-6oFJbEvWTXE/URHFnHgNeKI/AAAAAAAAeSc/UKgTVj0T8SA/s1600/hjkl.jpg\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: magenta; font-size: large;\"><b><br /></b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: magenta; font-size: large;\"><b>So much\nfor &nbsp;Freudian psychoanalysis of Eastern\nspirituality. These are the type of immoral rogues who secure Nobel prizes!!</b></span><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<br />\n<span style=\"font-size: large;\"><span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Hindu\nmysticism is not about only intellectual understanding and splitting hairs in a\nway nobody will understand , and hence ask no questions , but is based on transformation\nof the man himself. &nbsp;</span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-size: large;\"><span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-size: large;\"><span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The whole\npersonality of the western psychoanalyst is not involved in his work, only his education. No Indian sage will ever commit\nsuicide like western psychoanalysts.&nbsp;</span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-size: large;\"><span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-size: large;\"><span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">There is a big difference between the\nteacher and the pupil. The psychoanalyst is NOT even a teacher. He pretends to\nknow everything about the mind, but the poor guy does not know how to change\nhis own mind, leave alone the pupil's.</span></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-size: large;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<span style=\"font-size: large;\"><object class=\"BLOGGER-youtube-video\" classid=\"clsid:D27CDB6E-AE6D-11cf-96B8-444553540000\" codebase=\"http://download.macromedia.com/pub/shockwave/cabs/flash/swflash.cab#version=6,0,40,0\" data-thumbnail-src=\"http://3.gvt0.com/vi/1-OS8LU6JW8/0.jpg\" height=\"266\" width=\"320\"><param name=\"movie\" value=\"http://www.youtube.com/v/1-OS8LU6JW8&fs=1&source=uds\" /><param name=\"bgcolor\" value=\"#FFFFFF\" /><param name=\"allowFullScreen\" value=\"true\" /><embed width=\"320\" height=\"266\"  src=\"http://www.youtube.com/v/1-OS8LU6JW8&fs=1&source=uds\" type=\"application/x-shockwave-flash\" allowfullscreen=\"true\"></embed></object></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-size: large;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><br /></span></span></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-size: large;\">\n</span>\n<br />\n<div>\n<span style=\"font-size: large;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-size: large;\"><span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">What does a\npsychoanalyst do? &nbsp;He makes the patient lie down on a couch , three times a\nweek, and tells them to talk about their dreams and themselves. What can he extract\nout of this session other than money for himself. &nbsp;None of them even knew what REM sleep is all\nabout. The eastern mystic does NOT charge fees and hence he cares.<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-size: large;\"><span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Venkatraman &nbsp;Iyer later called Ramana Maharshi &nbsp;was born on Dec 30, 1879 at Thiruchuzhi near\nSivakasi, south of Madurai, India.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">He was friendly and\nopen-minded by nature and was loved by everyone in the village. He was a lively\nboy who liked to play pranks, more interested in sports like wrestling , soccer\nand atheletics than studies. He was stronger than the rest and he would win\neasily.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">He attended the local vernacular\nprimary school in Tiruchuli for three years before going to the English medium secondary\nschool in Dindigul when he was eleven.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">His family was aware of\nan old family legend, about how a Hindu ascetic came to the house begging for food,\nbut, against all Hindu tradition, he was not treated with the proper respect\nand was not given a meal. The ascetic promptly issued a curse, stating that\nhenceforth one member of each generation of the family would wander about\nbegging as an ascetic like himself. &nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This \u2018curse\u2019 had its\neffect, because in each generation one member renounced worldly life to become\na wandering ascetic. &nbsp;Sundaram Iyer was\nVenkatramana\u2019s father . &nbsp;One Sundaram\nIyer\u2019s uncles on his father\u2019s side had taken the saffron robe, the staff and\nthe lota of a sannyasin and had left to live life as a wandering renunciant . &nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">His own elder brother Venkatesa\nalso disappeared from the village one fine day, no doubt to embark upon the\nsame path. &nbsp;He&nbsp; was never heard of again and since that time\nSundaram had been the head of the joint family.&nbsp;\nThere are no indications that Sundaram Iyer ever thought that one of his\nsons would one day also leave home. &nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">And no doubt the thought\nnever crossed the mind of the young Ramana either. <o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://4.bp.blogspot.com/-cKqq6sPc5SU/URHSprLa6KI/AAAAAAAAeWU/qwd2RIvqXMs/s1600/sswww.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"259\" src=\"http://4.bp.blogspot.com/-cKqq6sPc5SU/URHSprLa6KI/AAAAAAAAeWU/qwd2RIvqXMs/s400/sswww.jpg\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">He did not study\nSanskrit or the sacred traditions of Hinduism such as the Vedas or the\nUpanishads. In both the missionary run schools he attended he was taught\nChristianity,&nbsp; but Hindu boys generally\nshowed little interest in such bible classes \u2013 and Ramana was no exception in this\nrespect. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Although he was very\nmuch like&nbsp; any other boy, he did have one\npeculiar trait. His sleep used to be exceptionally deep and most of the time he\nhad to be beaten awake.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">One day he had failed\nto study properly some lesson on &nbsp;English\ngrammar. As punishment for this , the English teacher gave him a punishment of copying\nout the lesson three times. When he came to the third copy his mind revolted\nagainst this soulless mechanical exercise. &nbsp;He pushed the work aside, sat upright in yoga\nposture, closed &nbsp;his eyes and started to\nmeditate. &nbsp;His elder brother Nagaswami, &nbsp;who had been watching him all the time, cried\nout ill-temperedly, \u201cWhy should one, who behaves thus, retain all this?\u201d &nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The shot went home.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">So, in I896 this\nsixteen-year-old schoolboy quietly walked out on his family and, driven by an\ninner compulsion,&nbsp; slowly made his\ndetermined way to Arunachala, a holy mountain and pilgrimage centre in Tamil\nNadu , South India. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">His parting letter\nwhich he left behind for his mother and brothers read, \u201cI have, in search of my\nFather and in obedience to his command, started from here. This is only for\nembarking on a virtuous enterprise. therefore none need grieve over this\naffair.&nbsp; To trace THIS out, no money need\nbe spent.&nbsp; Your college fee has not yet\nbeen paid.&nbsp; Rupees two are enclosed\nherewith\u201d<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The letter changes from\nthe personal \u201cI\u201d to the impersonal \u201cTHIS\u201d and ends with a long line instead of\na signature. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">From this day on he\nnever signed with his name again. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">When he was asked later\nwhy he did not sign his letter, he answered, \u201cThere was nothing deliberate or\nconscious about&nbsp; it. Simply that the ego\ndid not rise up to sign it.\u201d<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">So, at around twelve\nnoon on this fateful Saturday, Ramana left his family and Madurai and set off\nto take the train to Tiruvannamalai which was approximately 250 miles away. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">He was never to return.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">On the way he sold\nhis&nbsp; gold earrings set with rubies (such\nearrings are worn by Brahmins) for a song , to eat food and to buy a train\nticket . He arrived at Tiruvannamalai railway station from where he foot\nslogged to the holy mountain of Arunachala. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">He was to remain there\nfor the rest of his life.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The famous\nArunachaleswara temple at the foot of the hill is one of the largest temple\ncomplexes in Southern India.&nbsp; The temple\nis 3000 years old, but the current imposing structure dates back to the early\nChola dynasty ( 871-953 AD). &nbsp;Inside the\ntemple compound there are numerous shrines to various gods. The impressive hall\nhas exactly 1,000 richly decorated pillars,&nbsp;\nnumerous open pillared halls ,&nbsp;\ngardens,&nbsp; inner courtyards and two\ntemple ponds.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Overflowing with joy he\nhastened to this temple at the foot of Arunachala mountain , walked straight to\nthe inner shrine hugged the lingam with hot tears flowing ,&nbsp; and stayed there some time in the ecstasy of\ncomplete surrender.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">He then left the inner\ntemple compound and threw a packet of sweets , which he had , into the\nAyyankulam temple tank.&nbsp; A man saw him do\nthis and approached him and asked if he would like to have his tuft of hair\nremoved. Ramana agreed. One of the barbers who practised his trade at the\nAyyankulam tank, cut off his beautiful black locks and shaved&nbsp; his head. <o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://4.bp.blogspot.com/-CJSwr8zJT9o/UREselEFygI/AAAAAAAAeKI/kLbxkoBGxOQ/s1600/rbks007p.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"320\" src=\"http://4.bp.blogspot.com/-CJSwr8zJT9o/UREselEFygI/AAAAAAAAeKI/kLbxkoBGxOQ/s320/rbks007p.jpg\" width=\"242\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">He gave the barber some\nmoney and threw the rest of the 3 rupees eight annas away. Then he tore up the white\ncotton dhoti he was wearing and kept only one small piece as a loincloth. &nbsp;A loincloth (konam) would be his only clothing\nfrom now until the end of his life.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Cutting off the tuft of\nhair, which orthodox Iyer Brahmins &nbsp;have\non the back of their heads as a sign of their caste, and shaving the head are\nsigns of renunciation. &nbsp;From this day on\nhe never touched money again and never had any possessions. Finally, he removed\nhis Brahmin poonulu thread, the sign of his high caste status. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">He then abandoned\nhimself to a newly-discovered awareness that his real nature was formless,\nimmanent consciousness.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">His absorption in this\nawareness was so intense that he was completely oblivious of his body and the\nworld. &nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Ramana had first\nsettled down in the thousand-pillared hall in the temple compound, which is on\nthe right when entering the temple through the eastern tower. The hall, with\nits thousand richly carved stone pillars, is a raised stone platform, open on\nall sides.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Exposed to the gaze of\nthe general public in a&nbsp; place of\npilgrimage the strange youth soon roused the curiosity of the pilgrims. Street\nurchins started to pester him. &nbsp;No doubt\nthey felt provoked by a youth sitting motionless like a statue . They started\ntaking verbal potshots at him in sarcasm. &nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">One day, while Ramana\nwas sitting absorbed in meditation in the thousand-pillared hall, he was pelted\nwith a stone from behind, &nbsp;rudely\ndisturbing him. &nbsp;In order to escape such\ntroubles in future, he decided to withdraw to a dark windowless underground\nvault under the thousand-pillared hall, known as the Patala Lingam. &nbsp;The urchins would not dare to come in because\nof the extreme darkness that prevailed in the pit called Patala or hell.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-wrE0At9zOvo/UREoGM-WGMI/AAAAAAAAeJA/YaF-nKupeH8/s1600/imagescgjk.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"239\" src=\"http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-wrE0At9zOvo/UREoGM-WGMI/AAAAAAAAeJA/YaF-nKupeH8/s320/imagescgjk.jpg\" width=\"320\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">There was a<b> Shiva\nlingam,</b> &nbsp;behind which he sat down, leaning\nhis back against the wall. &nbsp;The cellar\nwas never used or visited and therefore never cleaned. &nbsp;No ray of sunlight ever &nbsp;penetrated here. It was also damp and overrun\nwith vermin and mosquitoes. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Young Ramana sat\nunmoved in yoga posture with legs crossed, impervious to the world and the\nmosquitoes which fed on his blood. &nbsp;Insects\nand rodents chewed away portions of his legs, his body wasted away because he\nwas rarely conscious enough to eat and his hair and fingernails grew to\nunmanageable lengths. His thighs, where they met the ground, were soon covered\nwith sores and ulcers, from which blood and pus oozed. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">These scars were to\nremain visible till he died.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://4.bp.blogspot.com/-_YrOzr3YMV4/URD3TccpR9I/AAAAAAAAeEo/do1g5DbxA5c/s1600/imagesmnbhjko.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"276\" src=\"http://4.bp.blogspot.com/-_YrOzr3YMV4/URD3TccpR9I/AAAAAAAAeEo/do1g5DbxA5c/s320/imagesmnbhjko.jpg\" width=\"320\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A pious woman named\nRatnammal found him there, and used to give him something to drink and eat. She\nlaid a clean piece of cloth beside him and bade him to use it as a bed or to\nsit on to keep at least some of the vermin away, but he took no notice and did\nnot even touch it.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Ramana neither spoke\nnor moved. People who saw him like &nbsp;this\nthought he was practising a severe tapasya. Because he was silent, though that\nhe had taken a maun vrit.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">But for Ramana this was\nno spiritual exercise at all, it was merely something that happened to him (\nKundalini raising from the wrong pingala nadi ). In his own words &nbsp;\u201cI have never done any sadhana. &nbsp;I did not even know what sadhana was. &nbsp;Only long afterwards I came to know what&nbsp; sadhana was and how many different kinds of\nit there were. &nbsp;Only if there &nbsp;was a goal to attain, I should have made\nsadhana to attain that goal. There was nothing which I wanted to obtain. &nbsp;I am now sitting with &nbsp;my eyes open. I was then sitting with my eyes\nclosed. That was all &nbsp;the difference. &nbsp;I was not doing any sadhana even then. &nbsp;As I sat with &nbsp;my eyes closed, people said I was in samadhi. &nbsp;As I was not talking, &nbsp;they said I was in mauna. &nbsp;The fact is, I did nothing. &nbsp;Some Higher &nbsp;Power took hold of me and I was entirely in\nIts hand.\u201d<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-xCRhlujgk-k/UREoR6xYjmI/AAAAAAAAeJI/Trx5tSWTwlo/s1600/stock-photo-arunachaleswar-temple-in-tiruvannamalai-dates-from-the-th-century-tamil-nadu-india-39805087.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"400\" src=\"http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-xCRhlujgk-k/UREoR6xYjmI/AAAAAAAAeJI/Trx5tSWTwlo/s400/stock-photo-arunachaleswar-temple-in-tiruvannamalai-dates-from-the-th-century-tamil-nadu-india-39805087.jpg\" width=\"255\" /></a></div>\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Ramana was in this dark\npit for a couple of months . One Venkatachala Mudali, a visitor to the temple,\nfinally brought him out of there, being told of a boy meditating &nbsp;in the dark pit.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Venkatachala Mudali\nreports, \u201cOne day, going near the thousand-pillared hall, I found a group of Muslim\nboys, &nbsp;hurling stones in the direction of\nthe pit entrance. &nbsp;Enraged at the sight I\nbroke a branched from a shrub , seized a twig, and ran towards the &nbsp;young scamps who fled promptly. &nbsp;Proceeding\ninside the dark vault , I could make out nothing for a while, as I was coming\nfrom the glare into the darkness. &nbsp;In a\nfew minutes, the faint outlines of a young face became discernible in that pit.\n&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Somewhat frightened, I ran\nout to the adjoining flower-garden where a&nbsp;\nsadhu was working with his disciples. Mentioning the facts to them I\ntook some of them with me. Even then the youthful figure sat motionless and\nwith closed eyes, despite the noise of our footsteps. Then we lifted the Swami\nfrom the pit full of mosquitoes , carried him from the hall\nup a flight of steps and deposited him in front of a shrine of Subrahmanya. The\nSwami still remained unconscious, his eyes closed; evidently he was in deep\nsamadhi. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">We noted the large\nnumber of open sores caused by rodent bites on the nether side of his thighs and\nlegs, with blood and pus flowing from some of them, and &nbsp;wondered how any one could remain unconscious\nof the body amidst such torture. Regarding it as irreverence, nay impertinence,\n&nbsp;to make any further noise in such\npresence, we bowed and came away.\u201d<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-HHX1d5WSXZ4/URD4Acb7aoI/AAAAAAAAeE4/SyV-hWuqAKM/s1600/imagestuop.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"249\" src=\"http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-HHX1d5WSXZ4/URD4Acb7aoI/AAAAAAAAeE4/SyV-hWuqAKM/s400/imagestuop.jpg\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">At the shrine of\nSubrahmanya there lived a Mauni Yogi and a group of mendicant ascetics, who had\nsettled down in the nearby garden. &nbsp;Sri\nRamana was cared for occasionally but not regularly. At noon each day the Yogi\nused to bring him a glass of milk collected from a stone basin after the\nsacrifice to the statue of Goddess Uma. This was no pure milk, but a murky\nmixture of various food offerings - milk, water and sugar mixed with turmeric\npowder, raw and ripe pieces of plantains and other sacrificial remains, which\nthe priest had poured over the devotional image. Indifferently Ramana swallowed\nit all.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">During this time any\nfood had still to be put into his mouth, as he would not eat what was merely\nplaced in front of him. Without the care of others the Swami would&nbsp; probably not have survived for long.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">He also often did&nbsp; not know whether it was day or night. Ramana\nrecall \u201cWhen I closed my eyes, deeply absorbed in meditation I hardly knew\nwhether it was day or night. If at any time I opened my eyes I used to wonder\nwhether it was night or day. I had no food and no sleep. \u2026 If there is no\nmovement, you do not need sleep. Very little food is enough to sustain life.\nThat used to be my experience. Somebody or other used to offer me a tumblerful\nof some liquid diet whenever I opened my eyes. That was all.\u201d<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://4.bp.blogspot.com/-iT-AQVFNkGQ/UREpXNNdJqI/AAAAAAAAeKA/qI64M8ypdmM/s1600/CGHJJKJJ.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"298\" src=\"http://4.bp.blogspot.com/-iT-AQVFNkGQ/UREpXNNdJqI/AAAAAAAAeKA/qI64M8ypdmM/s400/CGHJJKJJ.jpg\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Some people, who saw\nthe young ascetic sitting motionless like that thought, \u201cHe is sitting like a\nJada (dull-witted person), &nbsp;he must be a\nmad fellow.\u201d Ramana later said that he found such remarks amusing.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">He had discarded his\nkonam because of the sores and was sitting nude those days.&nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-Jv8084c-ssw/URFOw7zhRII/AAAAAAAAeQY/bgU2W7QW5bM/s1600/FGHMM.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"265\" src=\"http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-Jv8084c-ssw/URFOw7zhRII/AAAAAAAAeQY/bgU2W7QW5bM/s400/FGHMM.jpg\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;Ramana recounts \u201c After I had been nude for\nabout a month, this old Gurukkal told me one day, \u2018Boy, the Kartikai Deepam is\napproaching. People from all the 24 districts will be flocking here. Police\nfrom all the districts will also be here. They will arrest you and put you into\njail if you &nbsp;are nude like this. So you\nmust have a cod-piece.\u2019 So saying, he got Ramana a new piece of cloth, made\nfour people lift me up and tied a konam around me.\u201d<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://2.bp.blogspot.com/-MiIFL_q5g8Q/URFPN6OJGaI/AAAAAAAAeQg/nRkyMYXJtgg/s1600/imagesCFGH.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"265\" src=\"http://2.bp.blogspot.com/-MiIFL_q5g8Q/URFPN6OJGaI/AAAAAAAAeQg/nRkyMYXJtgg/s400/imagesCFGH.jpg\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">Above: Virupaksha Cave where &nbsp;Ramana Maharshi meditated &nbsp;for 17 years from 1899 to 1916. The Virupaksha\nCave is quite large and is about 330 feet above the Arunachaleswara temple on\nthe south-eastern slope of the mountain. The inner part of the cave contains the remnants of\nthe Saint Virupakshadeva, who performed severe acts of penance there in the\n13th century<o:p></o:p></span></i></span></div>\n<br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">At the following\nKartikai festival Sri Ramana\u2019s first disciple, Uddandi Nayinar, &nbsp;arrived and became a permanent companion. &nbsp;He had a bullock cart which he used to\ntransport people and goods from one town to another. &nbsp;Like so many other pilgrims he too had come to\nTiruvannamalai for the Kartikai festival and saw the young Swami sitting under\nthe Illupai tree absorbed in deep samadhi. &nbsp;In search of Self Realization and peace of\nmind he recognized in the young swami the living embodiment of the holy scriptures\nand said to himself, \u201cHere indeed is realization and peace, and here must I\nseek it\u201d <o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://3.bp.blogspot.com/-qkzCPonPZMU/URD3yba-gDI/AAAAAAAAeEw/ZV-gPVU5QAA/s1600/imagesjiop%5B.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"400\" src=\"http://3.bp.blogspot.com/-qkzCPonPZMU/URD3yba-gDI/AAAAAAAAeEw/ZV-gPVU5QAA/s400/imagesjiop%5B.jpg\" width=\"200\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">From then on he did not\nleave Ramana\u2019s&nbsp; side. He took care of his\nbodily needs and prevented him from being disturbed or bothered. &nbsp;He settled down at a short distance from him, observed\nthe crowds of visitors for hours at a time and drove away the urchins who found\nit amusing to cause trouble for the young ascetic. &nbsp;He also cooked simple meals, which he shared\nwith him.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Uddandi was a learned\nman. &nbsp;In Sri Ramana\u2019s presence he recited\nsacred Yoga and Vedanta texts such as Yoga Vasistha and Kaivalya Navaneeta. &nbsp;He longed to hear some words of instruction\nfrom his new guru, which would help him on the way to self realization and help\nhim find peace, but the swami kept silent and he, in his turn, did not dare to\nspeak to him.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">After two or three\nyears in this state he began a slow return to physical normality, &nbsp;a process that was not finally completed for\nseveral years.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">After his enlightenment\nat age 17 he led a simple life on the sacred Hill Arunachala, in Southern\nIndia, for over 50 years, until his death in 1950.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://4.bp.blogspot.com/-WWD2GR5MhCM/URD2i73f2KI/AAAAAAAAeEg/nucXjmk_JnQ/s1600/imagesioo.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"320\" src=\"http://4.bp.blogspot.com/-WWD2GR5MhCM/URD2i73f2KI/AAAAAAAAeEg/nucXjmk_JnQ/s320/imagesioo.jpg\" width=\"259\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">People whose Kundalini\nrises from the wrong nadi, &nbsp;( Pingala rather than the correct Sushumna )&nbsp;undergo this\ntype of terrible pain and ordeal. &nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;;
